34410656.review:
i played a lot of this in few weeks, as a former football manager fan, i missed the feeling of developing a team
things i liked: players develop into stars, you need luck, and need investment, 3-4 players can carry you to the next league and make nice profits from rest of players, the face generator is nice, each player has unique face which helps with rpg part, its a lot of fun winning the league and making better and better team
rock, paper , scissors, lizard , spok- skilsl beat other skills, strategies beat other strategies, changing back a midfielder to defence can mean the difference between a 2-0 lose or a 2-0 win
using 2-3 young players decreases your team value and increases the match revenue, also they get xp faster, bit more micromanagement but lot of  games i used 3-4 players actively and the closest defenders, squad rotation can be nice
your decisions and strategy matters, if you like high level strategy games with a lot of random then you will enjoy this

things are annoying: RNGsus, sometimes they intercept a ball with almost no mathematical chance then score from it,sometimes you get a lucky 2-0 lead, you cover the best players and the worst guys score from half pitch and beat you in min 90 from last action
new leagues are usually way out of your league, the player prices are crazy, you cant buy new stars, you cant afford them
big teams crush you so bad you dont even have the mood to restart over and over again you just exit and simulate, so needs patience each time you go for higher league
the replay value is not the best as things happen mostly the same way
the "less random events" mode has less random, the dice rolls between 30-100% but the generator seems predictable, if your player missed 2 chances, he will score next, end of half events fail a lot. this means that stars perform always good, small teams dont really  have a chance vs bigger teams and no strategy can save you
transferable players are randomly generated, you cant really manipulate the league buying the best players of your opponents
teams are mostly random, there is no strong club identity nor many combinations on defence, skills are better then invidual player stats, so you need the right ones
second team gains no xp unfortunately so no reason to buy more players other than the starters and substitutes
players on same level have the same skills, not much difference on base stat with 4skills
player prices are kinda too predictable also, if has a skill and high interest you get a profit, if has half year training better keep it. kinda sad that most time i used players to play in games to increase their prices so my best players stayed on bench for few years
you cant possibly win every game without restarting. you cant get sponsor money for win all home victory, those quests could be changed
kinda lot of balancing issues but the base game is solid and can be built upon

overall worth the price and the updates will be good, you will have fun until you figure out how to play and what are best strategies, just one more game feeling and transfers are fun, half year of play is around 90 mins which is good for people who work and dont have time to play all day,  the simulating function helps also, i started new after my first 2 years, then again after i reached 1st league, then i won easily my 3rd run with 5 star defender train and a great keeper. but then felt kinda bad anything else, even if are many options, the best order is usually the same and the player prices still increase if you need more than a year in the league. so the replay value is like 3 runs, and maybe trying different leagues
 
spoiler:
the general strategy is like a flash clicker game, you need to specialize to something rather than put points on everything
first 3 years you need to swap all old players to young ones, and as game xp is less, bonuses are bad, so just go for younger and bigger transfer list, change all midfielders to defensive train
skills are more important than stats
one forward (or midfielder) needs to have cannon shot and control training, the other high accuracy and dribble skills
set "penalty for playing on other position" only for goalkeepers or AI will use 3 gks as defenders
one midfielder needs layoff pass and set the opposite side of your cannon shot player, offset one, so he passes, player steps into the cannon shot position and gets extra turn
long pass is good when the layoff fails, and next time you can try again.
a midfielder with tackling can reach everybody from middle and slide in, defenders are too slow for it, they only block if ball goes trough them so you can use in T shape deffence and on middle of field, kinda most important player is the sliding midfielder with high pass
defenders and gks are on defensive training always, you cnat really use defenders on midfield as they are too slow to tackle, maybe if they got layoff/long pass but not advised
best offence is defence, i even tried it with 4 substitute goalkeepers, and gk training, a great gk can stop the best attackers but in higher leagues you need decent defenders as well, usually midfield is skipped, so formations like 5-2-3 or 6-1-3 are okay, mostly used 5-3-2, best is usually 5 defenders in a line and never let them to do a cannon shot
if they got nutmeg you can block with 2 players after each other, if they got dribble skill a deep defender can still be good

i would expect more elements from fm: player potentials, scouting, a closed system transfering enviroment, more skills, more tat types, ability to teach young players, useless and useful combination of player types, more styles of play, player moral and coach talks

34404158.review:
Football Tactics es un juego simple gráficamente, pero muy adictivo por su gameplay, que aunque fácil e intuitivo tiene muchas cosas por enseñarnos, en un principio los partidos nos parecerán sencillos, pero una vez ascendemos de división, las cosas nos serán más difíciles y las decisiones que tomemos repercutirán más en cada partido por lo cual el nivel de adicción aumenta.

Su gameplay se basa en estadísticas que no son cerradas, es decir, durante un partido las estadísticas de un jugador y las probabilidades para ejecutar una acción pueden variar haciendo que sea posible incluso ganar a un equipo superior al nuestro. El juego se desarrolla por turnos (tres movimientos por turno).

A nivel sonoro es bastante normal, algunos de los temas son bastante buenos pero se vuelven monótonos después de un tiempo.

Es un juego que al verlo no parece que fuera a enganchar… pero lo hace de sobre manera, lo único que cambiaría en él, es el aspecto gráfico que estuviese más acorde a la plataforma en la que se esta jugando, y no se que tan viable sea para el propósito del juego, pero ojala los partidos tuvieran una mayor duración, y el campo de juego fuese más grande.

Dieses Spiel ist ein vergleichsweise einfacher Fußball-Manager (es gibt nur Begrenzte Möglichkeiten sein Stadion auszubauen / Trainer einzustellen etc), ich bin gespannt ob da noch mehr kommt.

Dieses Spiel ist allerdings auch ein Strategiespiel, das an Schach erinnert. Oder Civilization. Und das macht unglaublich viel Spaß (jedenfalls mir) :-)

Allen, die das Fußball-Setting mögen, und Spaß an Rundenbasierter Strategie haben, sei definitiv ein Blick auf diesen Geheimtipp nahegelegt :-)

Was ich mir für die Zukunft wünschen würde:

- Grafische Darstellung des Vereinsgeländes und der Gebäude / Trainer
- Historie vergangener Erfolge nach Saison (aktuell werden nur Pokale für Siege in der Liga ausgestellt)
- Mehrere gespeicherte Aufstellungen. Ich entscheide mich vor den Spielen meisst für meine Standard-Aufstellung oder eine etwas defensivere Aufstellung, wenn die Gegner übermächtig sind. Diese würde ich gerne als Vorlage speichern.

34123051.review:
I like the idea behind this game – simple football manager combined with turn based match play. This is a casual game and if you treat it like that, it will be fun.

I’m looking forward to the AI/match update. Right now is the match play is good (not great). 

I do find some things annoying like:
- I think player on the field shouldn’t be able to use the same special ability twice within one action set (e.g. use rainbow faint twice in a row) especially since some special abilities on higher levels feel overpowered.
- ball interceptions should end action set
- players shouldn’t be able to tackle the same target more than once in the action set

As for the managerial part of the game, there are a lot of improvements that could be added without adding too much unwanted complexity, like:
- better stats, on team and league levels
- individual awards on the end of the season (best scorer, best 11, etc…)
- better scouting and transfer list
- ability to save preset formations
- more info on actual stadium visitors and capacity filled

Technically, the game runs great. My only remark is that you cannot add PNG as club logo, therefore no transparency. Also, there should be an option to restore the original club logo.

33902548.review:
My second review of a game ever.

Football tactics may seem very easy at first glance and very repetitive. But it isnt.

The game has some depth that you will see after you progress from the lower class off amatrur league.
I have almost all the football manager games but in the previous years i was some how "bored" of all the micro mangement.


Football tactics is offcourse not near the depth of football manager, but it isnt suppose to either.

The best thing i like about this game is :

+ You can build your own team and assign names
+ Easy to manage, not many messages to read before you start a game
+ The numbers displayed before you make a move so you an decide the right course of action
+ The fame you can implement in various things to uppgrade your skills on various positions

The only thing i think is minus, even though it is very small is that we should get more fame when you win matches, atleast in teh beggining so you can get a team going.

Going from amateur league 3 -> 2, i was amazed by the level between those 2 leagues. But when i saw that the team who came first in league 3 (i came second) also struggling liek me, made me feel better.

So there is a system:) 

I recommend this game to the fullest, enjoy.

33865203.review:
This game has potential but there are too many issues.  There are a lot of morons on this review section claiming this game to be the next FM or something, they are morons and nothing more, here is why the game does not work:

1. No set ups for volleys.
2. Poor UI, nothing is properly explained, why not just use a percentage calculator to determine the risk? Instead it compares 2 different stats and you're supposed to click through players looking what is happening.
3. BORING matches, you get about 2 attempts per half, most of the time it just ends up switching possesion at each others box, you can't actually work the ball back up the field and therefore you end up in this shit stain stalemate, only luck will save you then. May as well reboot the match and try again. By the time you work out of the stalemate, or build some momentum using the +turn skill abilities the halftime whistle blows.
4. This is top trumps, pretty much.  5 stats for each player...that isn't depth, all strikers do is shoot, they don't head the ball, volley it, nothing. Defenders tackle, midfielders pass, and there are auxilery stats that help ball retention such as control...k...
5. Training is none existent, players just LVLUP from XP, then you can TRAINSKILL, but you only get 1 choice until they hit 50...k...
6. They brag about face models...you literally won't notice, the kit making system and badge builder is pithy. 
7. Sad sack AI, they literally do the SAME strategy every match, kick the ball to an attacker, run around, go for a shot, if they got a skill they might get sweaty with it.
8. Formations made me LOL, I thought I was going to build positional play, nope, all you do is look at your opponents formation and respond in kind, put a defender where an attacker is, put attackers where defenders are not.  The AI can't respond, so you ALWAYS have the advantage.
9. You can't play defense, literally. There is ZERO marking system, they can run around in all adjacent squares of your defender and he will not move, the only time they will stop you is if you try to run through them, so all that happens is they build a wall, and so do you, that's the only way to stop them.  They will then, if they are lucky, attempt a dribble and woop, win win. 
10. Shooting is retarded, you may as well not attempt to make space, since you'll only have a few piddly shots, and dribbling is so damned hard to pull off, just shoot through 2/3/4 defenders, I scored more doing that than crafting a plan to breach their back line.
11. Speaking of making space, there is none, your players are CRAMMED in there tight, get ready for a boring tackle fests.
12. The set pieces are a f-cking distaster, you have to f-ck around marking people, then they roll based on their control then push you out of the way, then they boot it in.  Free kicks in field are worse, they move all their players in defense, there was literally 2 full lines of defenders in front of the box, whut a joke lads. 


In conclusion, they tried...but failed.  Ignore morons claiming this to be some sort of masterful strategy game, or the "I DIDN'T EVUN LIKES FUTBOL BUT I LUV THIS LOLOLOL." the reason why people who do not like football, like this, is because it has NOTHING to do with football, it doesn't even play like a macro match. It feels like a fleshed out mobile game tbh.  If you're an FM fan, this will bore you, it's a poor mans blood bowl through and through.
33865203.developer_response:
I respect your opinion. Part of what you say is true, but most of your points are the result of little playing. Many of so-called "morons" played 50-100-200+ hours before writing the positive review, after mastering the game. 

It seems it's not your kind of game. I assume it based on your reaction on how the real football elements (like set pieces) transformed to the turn-based mechanics. But I want to answer to show what is not really true in your review.

1) It's true. We do not simulate every detail of a football match. Rather, we want the match to represent the manager's macro decisions. Every action in the match is shown like one action, but by this action, we mean 2 minutes of the match where the players perform some less tactically important things, and which result in the action shown in the game. 

2) UI is explained in the coach's notes. There are even pictures which explain these numbers. There are some things which we do not explain or explain briefly. But we will explain them in the next update, adding a Footballapedia to the game. Back to your comment - comparing players' potential is one of the important match's mechanics. Showing percents would break some things.

3) When players write about the boring match - it's true for the lower leagues. Because the Amateur and Third leagues represent the amateur football in general. You won't see beautiful football in such games. When your players get stronger and learn skills, you will see that the matches are very tactical. Especially in the higher leagues. You won't win the Prestige Cup without tactics. Also, beating the stronger opponents is possible only if you master using skills and think ahead. And it's the only way to play in Premier league and European tournaments,

4) If players have 8-10-20+ stats but in the end of the day you are not sure why you win or lose the matches, these stats do not matter. Every stat should be very important if you are going to make important and fun decision. We found a golden middle between amount of stats and the depth of the tactics. XCOM soldiers do not have 20+ stats to represent absolute shooting reality. They have only a few, and it doesn't make XCOM a bad game. 

5) You are right. Training is nonexistent in the way it implemented in other football manager games. We don't want any part of the game to be a chore. However, we think about adding a bit of complexity to training in future. Also, the skills training will be improved in one of the next updates, giving a more valuable choice.

6) You are partly right. There is not enough places where we show these faces. However, we will add more possibilities to see your players closer. 

7) AI is quite smart there. It knows the best chances to score, so it will behave the same if the situation on the pitch doesn't change. But when you master the game and play smartly, AI will search different ways to your goal. However, I should admit, there are few things where AI might be better. For the next huge update, we wrote our AI 2.0 which supports the new, much deeper match mechanics. It becomes even smarter. Will be released soon.

8) It's partly true. Putting a strong forward where weak opponent's defender is - is a tactics from real life, isn't it? However, there are more to it than you are saying. Especially, when you consider skills. They add a totally new layer of depth when you want to win something, not just playing. There are also other tactical aspects in formations. 

9) There is no defence like in real football - that's true. However, placing the defenders is tactical and important. For example, here's a guide, which explains the positioning of the defenders: http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=526764180 The next update will add much more. There will be sweepers, there will be CDs who can auto tackle the ball if an opponent moves near, there will be flank defenders. But yeah, currently we don't have those in the game.

10) Shooting through 2/3/4 defenders is possible in Amateur league, when you play against much weaker teams. But it's not a good way of shooting in Football Tactics in general. You should use skills,, you should decide beween Precision and Power shot which give different possibilities. Dribbling is hard if your forward can't dribble. Train Control stat for that. And it's one of the tactics - to have a good dribbler in the team. As I said earler, this game is based on the macro decisions. So it doesn't have the level of details of realistic 90 minutes match. But being a "macro" game, it allows to make valuable decision for 5-10min matches and have fun.

11) Sometimes it's true. Depends on your and opponent's players. It's very true for amateur football which you saw playing in the lower leagues.

12) It's a disaster if you need a 100% realistical football. Taking to account the grid and game's speed, we implemented the real mechanics in our turn-based system. It lacks total realism, but it represents the real football and allows you to make few important decisions instead of making many unimportant ones.

Again, if it's not for you - that's okay. You seem expect realism while we wrote in the game's description that we inspired more by XCOM than Football Manager even though we love football and try to create this feeling of managing your club in realistic football world. 

Other players, who love Football Tactics are not morons. They might accept the level of the conventionality of Football Tactics and by accepting that, they see football, football drama (which indeed exists there), club development (which becomes fun after some time playing the game). In most cases, I saw that when players master skills and play to Premier league, they start to see the game's depth, they start to see how their decisions shape their club, and they like Football Tactics. 

Anyway, if you give the game another chance (maybe starting a new campaign with real world mods?) and master the game mechanics, it would be great. If not, thanks for your review anyway. It shows us that we do not teach players in the lower leagues enough.

33812812.review:
Schon einmal gefragt, was passieren würde, wenn ich ein Rundenstrategie Element in den Sport Bereich verfrachte? Nun, Football Tactics bietet eine sehr interessante Antwort darauf. 

Das Spiel simuliert zunächst einmal einen sehr interessanten Ligabetrieb (von der jeweils untersten Liga aufwärts soweit ich weiß) und erlaubt dem Spieler in diesem Zusammenhang rudimentäre Einflüsse auf den Verein. (Ausbau der Stadionskapazität, Verbesserung der Scouts und Trainer etc.), ohne dabei jedoch wie der FIFA Manager so sehr ins Detail zu gehen, dass man gefühlte 2 h braucht, um endlich die Vergrößerung der Tribüne zu bewerkstelligen. Hier ist der Simulationsbereich sehr übersichtlich, jedoch nicht zu einfach gehalten. Das Kernstück des Spiels ist ja per se generell etwas Anderes:

Hauptteil des Spiels sind die einzelnen Spiele selbst. Dort, wo man normalerweise, je nach Hand-Augen-Koordination, mal besser, mal schlechter, mit einem Controller versucht, möglichst viele Tore zu schiessen, haben die Entwickler es geschafft, das ganze in ein taktisches Korsett zu giessen, ohne jedoch den Spielfluss zu unterbrechen oder zu unterminieren. Jede Seite innerhalb eines Spiels hat 3 Züge für Aktionen Zeit, bevor die Gegenseite ihrerseits Aktionen ausführen kann. Es kommt dort wirklich jede Menge Spass auf und kann manchmal richtig, richtig schwer und herausfordernd sein. 

Die Entwickler, ein russisches Team, geben sich, soweit ich das bisher überblicken kann, Mühe und gehen auch aktiv auf die Community ein und schenken der ein Gehör. Etwas was natürlich weder per se immer so ist bzw. auch nicht immer so umgesetzt wird. Selbstverständlich hat das Spiel originalerweise keine Lizenzen der Fussballligen etc, aber diese kann man ohne große Probleme mittels Mods aus der Community heraus herunterladen und im Spiel integrieren. 

Ich kann das Spiel auf jeden Fall empfehlen!

33807516.developer_response:
Please, play longer and find out how the skills work. Lower leagues are easy because they consist of amateurs. But in the higher leagues, you will have to be smart and tactical to win the opponents. 

Here are few important tips:
1) Use skills often because if performed successfully _through an opponent_ they give +1 bonus action to your team. It's very important in the matches against stronger opponents.
2) At the kick off, the skills are not available because the players should concentrate.
3) Use Power Shot if your chances to score are not high, but you want to get a corner or to not give the ball to the opponents.

In the long term, you will see how your decisions affect your team development.

PS if you want to play with the real leagues and real clubs, you can subscribe to modifications: http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/workshop/

After you subscribe to the needed leagues, start a new campaign.

33424844.review:
I bought this game for all the positive reviews and the novelty concept. I always liked tactical games and being a management game at the same time is a nice bonus. 

The overall game concept is nicely executed and fun to play. I tried to like it and would have normally spent days playing this game, if it weren't for one design choice, which absolutely broke the game for me.

You can restart and exit ongoing matches at will. 

While at first this doesn't sound too bad or severe it is symptomatic for the underlying problem. The game is not designed around you losing or struggling in a division. At the same time the game showers you with rewards, if you manage to beat the enemy by a big margin. 

Which you inevitably will. You will beat far stronger enemies simply restarting a couple of times until you are lucky and then stalling it out. You will always be first place in any division until the enemy gets so ridicolously strong that it is no fun to play.

It is a nice game with a nice concept, but I personally wouldn't have bought it.

Edit: changed to positive after getting feedback. Read the comments if you are interested.
33424844.developer_response:
Hi, thanks for the review and showing what you don't like about Football Tactics. 

The goal of my answer is to show that the game is not designing around winning everything, and there are ways to see it.

1) Not sure if you mastered using skills, but they make a huge difference in how you play the game. Because they allow you to use different tactics and approaches to every opponent, and in general - to how you build your team. 

2) We want the game to be a living "open world". In the Amateur league, we do give the weak opponents to the player. But then, the world lives by itself. Stronger teams promote to the top, weak teams fall to the lower leagues. You can develop the club how you feel is right for you. Want to level up your players staying in the lower league - do it. Want to develop your youth - do it. Want to rush throughout the leagues - you can try.

3) We want the game to be similar to the real world. Stronger teams beat the weaker ones in the most cases. But if you gathered right players, if you prepared good counter tactics to the opponent, there are high chances to beat an even much stronger opponent. 

4) When you play a lot, you can see that the match results strongly depend on your tactics and formation, not the luck. However, luck is the important factor as well (as in real football). The luck mechanics is our way to show how in the real football even the best footballers can miss the whole match, and how one stupid shot from a weaker team can ruin the game. 

However, not everyone likes how rng affects the results.  So we provided 2 ways to lower its effect. One way is "Restart" button. The second way is a game mode "Less Random". You can start a new campaign. And there will be plenty of game setting to make the game suit your tastes. "Less random" option makes the players' potential to roll not from 0 to its maximum value, but from 30% to the max value. 

- - - -

Hope you will get back to the game and have a lot of fun with it ;)

32800722.review: Mit dem geschickten Einsetzen der Spielerfähigkeiten kann man fast jeden Gegner schlagen. Es macht Spass seinen Verein nach vorne zu bringen. Wer Fussball und Rundenbasierte Spiele mag, macht hier nichts falsch.
32800722.developer_response:
Hallo Bruno

Es tut mir leid, dass Sie unser Spiel nicht mögen. Allerdings scheint es, dass der Grund dafür ist, dass es Ihnen nicht klar war, wie man Fähigkeiten einsetzt. Das Spiel ist sehr taktisch. Aber um das zu verstehen, musst du mit Fähigkeiten beherrschen. Also, hier sind meine Vorschläge:

- machen Sie Ihre Spieler lernen Fähigkeiten
- Fähigkeiten nutzen, wenn möglich
- Sie erhalten +1 Aktion für die erfolgreiche Fertigkeit, wenn es _through_ der Gegner durchgeführt wird
- die Fähigkeiten sind bei der ersten Runde nach dem Auftakt nicht verfügbar
- ändere deine Taktik je nach dem Gegner, den du spielst
- versuchen Sie nicht, sich selbst zu spielen, sondern sehen Sie, wie AI spielt. Es weiß, wie man Fähigkeiten einsetzt und wie man starke Seiten deines Teams benutzt
- Ich möchte Ihnen versichern, dass das Spiel nicht ganz zufällig ist. Es hängt von deiner Taktik sehr viel ab

Allerdings, wenn Sie möchten, dass das Spiel weniger zufällig ist, starten Sie eine neue Kampagne und es wird eine Möglichkeit, 'Weniger zufällige' Option zu wählen.

Hoffe, du wirst dem Spiel eine weitere Chance geben.

- - -
Written in English, translated with Google Translate

32038184.review:
[h1]Unbalanced RNG and rampant unfairness ruin a very promising game.[/h1]

Put about 20 hours into Football Tactics so far, I'm about ~40% done achievement wise and played through 5 seasons so far.

The game is very promising, there is a glimmer of what could be a very good tactics game, unfortunately, it's a pretty shitty football game. The AI is very binary, and with the RNG dice rolls and the way the AI gets players makes the game inherently unfair. For example;

My last game the opposing team had a Goalkeeper with ~90 defence and one Striker with ~65 Accuracy. The rest of their team was awful and did not impact on the team at all. As my Strikers are ~40-50 Accuracy and my Goalkeeper is ~50 defence, no matter how I attacked it was impossible to score, no matter how their team attacked it was impossible for them not to score. Result, 6-0 loss.

This is further exasperated by the AI. The AI knows that the Striker will score every shot. This means every turn for the AI consists of 2 passes to that striker, and a shot from max range that will always score. That's right, their League 3 Striker scored [b]6 50yard screamers in one match.[/b]


Add to this a lack of crossing or headers, defenders moving one square only (no wing backs in this game...) there are no actual football tactics in this football game. Nearly every match relies on using your best passer to play down the middle to your best striker, score. Reset, do the same again.

I've seen matches where both myself and the AI can score in 3 moves from kick off, lots of 6-6 or 7-7 draws etc. in this game.

The way the RNG works can also lead to massive swings. Whatever the stat is for your player is the max they can roll. So if you have a defender with 25 defence they will roll a D25 for every action, if the Striker has 50 Accuracy they will roll a D50. The Striker is almost guaranteed to win every dice roll.

The skill system is obtuse and doesn't always seem to trigger, a lack of defensive options (Pressing and ending the turn seemingly has zero affect on the AI), AI bonuses leading to whichever 3 teams were relegated nearly always winning the league by huge margins and a lack of management simulation, I really can't recommend the game. The training and sim systems are particularly bad, with players being sold/bought on a whim without needing to go to a team, you can't choose what to train your players in (skills are randomly allocated) and a lack of any real management beyond buying some one shot upgrades for bonus exp.

To finish up fully, I could see myself needing to grind for 20-25 seasons slowly leveling up players. [b]It's often better to deliberately lose games and finish fourth for several seasons than get promotion to a new league.[/b] Every draw and loss has a chance to lose you fans and reduce your income on a weekly basis.

Avoid unless they make significant changes.
32038184.developer_response:
It's always hard to know that someone doesn't like your game. But everyone can have its own opinion and taste. So no problem with that.

However, from your review, I see that one important part of the game wasn't clear for you. And it hugely affected your experience. 

This feature is Skills. 

When you master using them, when you start developing your team to get the maximum from the skills, you will see the tactical depth of Football Tactics. Pass+Pass+Kick is tactics for an Amateur League. To win the stronger opponents with higher stats, you have to use skills smartly.

We know that currently, it is explained not very well in the game. So I will write there few important notes:
- the skills are not available after kick off
- the skills give +1 bonus action after performed successfully _against an opponent_

So there aren't bugs in which the skills do not trigger. It's just the cases we haven't explained well.

Other than that, there are few additional notes.

1) You might feel that we intentionally affect RNG to be unfair for the players. But it's not true. There aren't any reason for us to do that. 

2) We wanted Football Tactics to simulate the random nature of the football when even stronger footballers just play badly the whole match. The RNG simulates it. But if you don't like it, start a new campaign and select an option "Less random". With this option, the effect of the RNG will be decreased significantly. 

3) No matter whether you play with this option or not, when you master using skills and building your team with needed skills, you will see that on the big scale RNG doesn't affect your results much. As in real football - if your team is strong, and the tactics is smart - some random losses won't stop you.

4) We are working on the next huge update which will add headers, crosses and other football elements to the game. The game will be much deeper http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/590375319499622407

Hope you will win Premier league with very skilled team and change your opinion about our game

32028726.review:
[h1]What is it?[/h1]
THIS is the football manager game for people who don't understand football manager games, or for people who really don't know (or care) a lot about football even!  It's a manager game for people who have little patience for poring over the big spreadsheet-management games that the pros play and who don't want to be swamped by stats and the minutiae of skill points typically found in the bigger games in this genre.  This is manager-LITE!

[h1]How easy is it to play?[/h1]
Very easy - you can literally jump right in and play from the start with the very simple tutorial.  The game is mostly point-and-click.  Stats screens are few and simple.  The management functions are very basic but effective.  Best of all, you don't need to know the first thing about football (soccer to our American friends).  You can do pretty much everything that you can do in a full-blown management sim, except it's all very simplified and lightweight here.  Fans of full management games will probably not enjoy this one at all, but for those of us who could never master the bigger games, this one is perfect!

You start out by either selecting a pre-existing team (it seems quite a few countries are supported) or you can create your own team.  I picked my local town's team and found myself starting out in the lowest amateur league.  If you choose to create your own team, there is a superb player editor where you can (hope to) emulate your favourite players' faces in the creator screen if you have that kind of patience.  Once you have your team, there are no numbers to play with at this stage, so it is a case of starting your first match.  You can watch, simulate or actually play the match yourself.  Playing is easy and turn-based: click on a player, choose one of his available moves, then click to execute the move.  You get three moves per turn, and then it's your opponent's turn.  Everything is demonstrated in a simple, hands-on tutorial.   If you don't want to play and prefer to stick with team progression only, you can simply watch the game instead.  However, I found playing the match to be a lot of fun.

If you win, you'll accrue both fame points and cash with which you can upgrade your team, your club and your stadium.  You can manage contracts and recruit new players, and there is a basic screen to play with tactics.  Again, it's all very simple. 

[h1]What's good about it?[/h1]
Simplicity!  Everything is so clean and nicely presented.  No fussy user interface, everything displaying context descriptions when hovered over with the pointer, and every part of the game very simple to play, requiring no knowledge of football as a sport, or of manager games generally.  The graphics use a fun art style that I found to be quirky and amusing, and the few tables of stats were simple and self-explanatory.  A real joy to people who have no patience (like me...)! 

[h1]Anything not to like?[/h1]
My only disappointment is that, in creating a team, I cannot opt for a female team instead.  That's a bit nit-picky, but the excellent graphics style would easily have accommodated female players too - something I would have loved.  Other than that, everything is great for this level of casual game.

[h1]In summary...[/h1]
I've lost count of how many football-manager games I've bought and then not played over the years.  This one is basic enough for people who don't have patience for the bigger management games.  While it's definitely at the 'casual' end of the gaming spectrum, it's one of those lightweight games that hits a perfect balance between simplicity and the fun (and addictiveness) of a management-genre game.  If you're like me and have found the big-name footie management games a bit too much of a chore or trial to understand, then this game is for you.

Recommended!

31685281.review:
Gioco molto molto buono.
E' un gioco con ambientazione calcistica e dalla doppia anima: tattico e gestionale.
Si inizia come manager di una squadra di calcio che parte dall'eccellenza per arrivare a vincere la serie A ed anche le coppe Europee. Il gioco si svolge conducendo la squadra nei vari match e poi occupandosi di impostare gli allenamenti, fare le compravendite potenziare le giovanili gli allenatori fondamentali per il miglioramento dei nostri giocatori, il fulcro della nostra economia e quindi della nostra gestione più o meno positiva anche nel lungo termine. Lo dico subuto il gioco è cmq semplice da padroneggiare, ma ciò non mi è sembrato affatto un male. E' un giusto mix tra profondità e leggerezza anche se a vantaggio della leggerezza.
L'aspetto tattico del gioco riguarda lo svolgimento delle partite: è per intenderci stile Final fantasy Tactics, i vari giochi di Holly e Banji, il Blitzball di Final Fantasy 10, oppure la mappa strategica di Civilization e Rome Total war.
L'aspetto gestionale riguarda tutto il resto ed ingloba la parte tattica che però è il cuore del gioco.
Più difficile a spiegarsi che a giocarsi: il gioco difatti nonostante appartenga a generi non esattamente entry level è molto entry level, l'approccio è molto easy, l'interfaccia è molto amichevole ci spiegherà velocemente e con grande chiarezza tutte le dinamiche del gioco, la difficoltà non è altissima, però credo che padroneggiando al meglio, oppure no, le varie dinamiche soprattutto allenamenti ed il momento in cui vendere i giocatori si possa fare parecchia differenza.
Molti i Pro, giusta profondità, allo stesso tempo semplicità e curva di apprendimento rapida, buona immersione nel gioco, sonoro gradevole, giocabilità immediata e grafica gradevole, buona sfida, buon livello di strategia/pianificazione delle operazioni di acquisto e di gestione della squadra funzionale alla crescita.
Pochi i contro e le cose che se aggiunte dagli sviluppatori (tra l'altro molto disponibili al dialogo, troverete vari loro interventi nelle discussioni) e pare che le vogliano aggiungere nei prossimi updates farebbero quasi decollare un gioco già molto buono. Mancano classifiche cannonieri, storico ed albo d'oro dei record individuali (la raccolta dei trofei di squadra c'è già) piccole cose che aumenterebbero di molto l'immersione nel gioco. Inoltre sarebbe gradito una caratteristica nascosta in tutti i giocatori tale da determinare un potenziale diverso nella crescita degli stessi. In parte già c'è ma aumentarlo farebbe la differenza sempre in termini di maggiore immersione. Forse a 15 € costicchia un pò.
Insomma gioco davvero più che buono, tra i migliori dei giochi Indie tra i quali giochi Indie anche con recensioni buone si nascondono delle porcherie allucinanti tipo Punch Club giochi molto frustranti e poco bilanciati nonchè interfacciati male.  Quindi è già uno dei migliori giochi in circolazione, credo che con quelle modifiche, che dovrebbero arrivare, possa diventare un cult game e di ottimo livello. Consigliato molto a chi ama gli strategici e consigliato, un pò meno, anche solo a chi ama il calcio e lo sport ma non i gestionali.

31673475.review:
Football Tactics is a nice little mix of tactical turn based strategy, simulation, and management. You take the role of the coach for a really crappy team playing in the 4th division of your country's league.  The game does not have licensed teams, but it supports the Steam workshop and the community has been great in adding a huge amount of real teams to the game.

I did a video review that I highly recommend watching. Not only is it incredibly informative but it also shows a lot of footage of skill usage which, in my opinion, the game does a poor job of explaining.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XlCYiTCwiEo&t=25s

I was struggling with the game once my team was promoted to the 3rd division. All the enemy teams now had skills and I had no idea how to combat them or even use mine. The in-game tutorial only teaches you the bare basics of how to move, pass, and shoot. Skills are taught via the "coaches notes" which pretty much show you a screenshot of the skill as well as a little bit of text.

Videos, demonstrations, etc would have been much more helpful. It wasn't until I started to watch simulated games and saw how the AI used the skills of my players did I finally understand them.

And then I realized just how OP the skills are. Cannon shot, olympic kick, and rainbow feint are absolutely ridiculous. One of my guys, a low level forward, was able to use rainbow feint to not only get past 2 defenders but also through the goalkeeper for an incredibly easy, and unsatisfying goal. 

Olympic kick allows the corner kick guy to shoot directly into the goal. It works 99% of the time. 

The only way to protect yourself from these skills is to have defensive skills but these are extremely rare and can still fail. This works for the computer as well and it was how I was able to quickly dominate and reach 1st place of the Ukrainian Premier League fairly quickly despite only having a team with a 3-star rating and most of my opponents having 4.5 stars.

Currently, the game lacks depth and strategy. Every match is almost the same. After kick off, I pass to my forward, he gets into position and attempts to score. The shot is either deflected, caught, or goes in. Then the opponent does the same thing, then I do the same thing. However, on my next turn, I'm able to use skills (you can't use them immediately at kickoff) and then I can just spam cannon shot or rainbow feint for free goals.

It gets easier later on since the AI is terrible. They never take into account your formation and will gladly have an awful defensive one which will allow you to spam cannon shots.

I've had a match where the opponent had 0 forwards. It was 6 defenders and 5 midfielders. This team had a 4.5-star rating but it didn't matter as they could never score. Other times I've had teams that were using terrible midfielders who got into position to attempt to score but never did instead of passing to their forwards.

As players start retiring, the AI starts using low-level players on the field (instead of training them earlier after they came from the youth academy) and it is so easy to exploit that especially if the guy is a goalkeeper or defender. 

At this point, I doubt I'll be playing this again until a new update arrives. Currently, every season is the same, I win everything, my players get even stronger, and the enemy teams are even weaker as their stars retire and are replaced with low-level trash. 

However, I do think it is worth it. $15 is chump change and I got around 30 hours of enjoyment out of it. The devs are responsive and are continually updating the game.  I do recommend watching the video I linked above as it is far more positive than this criticism. This is just a collection of my thoughts after putting in about 7 after I made the video and saw that I pretty much did everything the game has to offer.

There are a lot of things that I feel this game is missing. It needs more strategy, more depth, skills reworked and more variety. I know that specified positions are in the works (defensive midfielders, offensive ones, CBs, etc) and I'm looking forward to it.

I also want more upgrades to be available. The current ones are all linear and boring. Money is only used to increase stadium capacity and improve your youth league. Fame is used increase experience gain. Using fame to upgrade the free agency is pointless and a complete waste of currency.

I think it would be interesting to add things like food, alcohol, security, maintenance, and other things. The game just feels "too basic" if you know what I mean. It's incredibly enjoyable when you're struggling in the bottom 2 divisions, but after enough time passes, you will have players with OP skills and you'll breeze through everything.

It's also odd that there is no stat decay. Your forward will perform better when he's 40 years old as opposed to 26 which doesn't make any sense. 

I'd like for the game to have replays. Sometimes, when you're losing badly but manage to win at the end is extremely satisfying but there are no replays of even goals. 

I'd also like to have the ability to change the age of my squad. It'd be really nice if I could make them as young as possible and then take them all the way to the top. I get attached to my players and loved keeping the same squad in the Master League mode of PES.

I look forward to the updates as this game was incredibly satisfying at the start and has an extreme amount of potential.

31513261.review:
Good day good gaming folk.

I'm going to go for a lengthy review because I feel the game deserves it.

Firstly I like it. Sort of. And I dislike it. Sort of a little bit more than I like it.

This is not a fully negative review, it can change as the game is developed and progresses. At the moment it's fun to play but not for more than a handful of hours. I'm not inclined to start playing again from scratch unless something changes in the games development, so for me replayability isn't fantastic at the moment. I'm stressing the at the moment though!

There are positives to the game, it's a unique prospect with things that set it apart from other games that I've played (not an avid steam gamer). The fact that its turn based makes a big difference into making each game kind of special, however the fact that it relies on pure chance makes it fairly predictable and unpredictable at the same time. There are instances in the game when the ai and yourself just get into patterns of repetive moves. These moves are just the most efficient moves available to either side, then it literally just comes to rolling the dice. Hence the predictable (which move is made) and the unpredictable (the randomness of dice if the teams are fairly matched).

Surprisingly for someone who normally gets a game fairly quickly and figures things out I've come stuck in first division somewhere. I think that this is in part because I progressed too quickly through the lower divisions and am now in first division with little money, crummy players compared to the ai and no income. The fact that all the players on the transfer list are well above anything I can afford is a little disheartening as I have in theory played the game well (promoted 3 times in a row). Yet I'm now doing a season in second division then a season in first division where I still get destroyed becasue my team is only 2 stars. And as I said I can afford any decent players when I get to the first division.

The players look nice as does the general design of the game. However I'm not someone that really gives a damn about choosing what my players look like, its only important if you like gazing at your players profile lovingly for lengthy periods of time. Which I, as of yet, haven't done. The player design element is therefore a little lost on me and the same goes for the kit/badge design.

The development of youth players is a struggle as well. Especially when in the first division (not even premier division). When I had a 3 star youth academy and it cost 6.5 million to improve it. Which is out of the question when your only getting 100,000 a game. At that point the players that are produced by the youth academy are good, but not good enough for the first division. Its nigh on impossible to grow a youth team player in the first division without going down (I tried twice with two players each time). The way the game works means that every weak link is easily exposed, so if there's one useless defender then there's no way to avoid the ai going through him to the goal. And if there's a useless attacker then your other attacker(s) need to be very very good in order to compensate. It sort of all comes down to money again because I've never been able to afford a decent enough player that would offset the risk of playing youth team players.

The english could be improved in places.

Skill growth is kind of random. Expect attackers with +-50 defence even when training something else and keepers with +-50 attack. Maybe these could be ruled out unless the manager really wants to train those?

The extra skills are cool. They add another layer of tactical play to the game, however some are extremely overpowered. Rainbow flick/Cannon ball are way op. Long pass, layoff are good (ai doesn't really use layoff much?). Sliding tackle is overpowered in my opinion as well, there should be a trait to learn that counters a sliding tackle.

The thing when players 'get mad' after failing to do something is stupid. All of a sudden after managing to tactically defend the oppositions best attacker for all half he goes abosultely balistic and can pretty much score from anywhere on the pitch because his accuracy increases by about double. It doesn't really add anything to the game for me because it just punishes you for defending properly. 

So my pointers to improve the game (we're all nice folk after all and just want the best for humanity):

-remove the scaling on the transfer list, it means you can't buy a player when you've just promoted because they're too expensive. There should be players of more price ranges available at all times.
-weaken the player going mad thing, it only ever punishes me for tactically blocking an attacker.
-think about tweaking the cannonball and rainbow flick, these are too powerful in my opinion.
-think about adding smaller traits, like players being 'sturdy' so they receive a boost to their chances when they get slide tackled. Or players 'touch' players who can immediately control a long ball and precision shoot.
-consider allowing youth players to grow whether they are playing or not. its more realistic and makes the youth academy more plausible.
- make the English more interesting to read
- The strange messages from the 'chairman' at the end of the season don't really add anything.
- penalties are completely random (maybe add a small trait like penalty boss or something?)
- free kicks are a problem as well, the ai has no clue how to defend them and for the player themselves its far too easy to defend them.

I think thats it. Although I'll add more if I think of it.

Thanks for the game and good luck improving it!
31513261.developer_response:
Thanks for the thoughtful review! As a developer who put his heart and soul in the game, it's always hard to know that the overall feeling is more bad than good. However, it's very helpful to see what things make you feel that way. Hope you will continue playing, and will see that there's more fun than you see now. Plus, new improvements are coming. I'll write some thoughts and tell about some future improvements there:

- despite Football Tactics is game, we put a lot of effort in making all mechanics feel close to a real world. Real football is partly predictable, partly - not. Developing young footballers is much harder but cheaper in the long term than purchasing footballers on the transfers. Quick grow become a struggle for the club if there is not enough basis for the growth. When you start a new campaign, you might notice that the replayablity is good enough, and your new campaign will go differently than your current one. (However, I advice you to overcome the hard times and win Premier league. You will have a lot of fun).

- do you consider selling your top players to invest money in the club/new footballers? Selling your footballers is one of the game's strategies. It makes it much easier to develop your club.

- Attributes are not entirely random. First - you get 1 point to the attribute you are training. Second - every footballers have inner propensities. Footballers develop their attributes based on their propensities. It allows players to experiment with different tactics. For example, some DFs can really help in the midfield. Some MFs are great in attack etc.

- If you have a time and will, I'd really appreciate at least some screenshots with wrong English texts. The game is translated by an US translators. But people might make mistakes I suppose :(

- we are actively thinking about remaking the Motivation mechanics. It creates some interesting situations but we are agree that while you are weak, it makes the game harder. The system will be changed in one of the closest updates.

- the overall balance of the skills will be changed in the next update. As we are adding a whole new huge system of game classes, the matches will become much more diverse: http://steamcommunity.com/games/375530/announcements/detail/590375319499622407

- the penalty mechanics will be changed as well in the one of the next updates. It should depend on the footballers' attributes than on the random direction.

There are other improvements in the next updates. I write about them in the news and in the forum. If you have any questions about the game, don't hesitate to ask there: http://steamcommunity.com/app/375530/discussions/ 

Hope you will continue playing our game. 

And thanks again for the detailed review.

31468488.review:
[quote]It is inspired more by the likes of JRPGs, Civilization, and XCOM rather than by Football Manager.[/quote] Maybe it is just me but I don't see a whole lot of JRPG/Civilization here but definitely XCOM.


How similar to XCOM is this game? Well, I will tackle this topic first. 

So is the game similar to XCOM? I'd say yes, to the newer ones. Enemy Unknown and XCOM2. It is actually as close to XCOM as a football game probably can be. The numbers system is a bit different here but the basic idea is the same. The game involves a lot of risk management and evaluations, around said numbers and skills. In XCOM you can use supressing  fire, in Fooball Tactics you can use pressing, which lowers the enemy accuracy, ball control etc, just as a simple example. So yes, the game is very similar to XCOM, biggest difference being that your team can't just go on the field and straight out die. They can get injured though.


So the game is awesome. I haven't encountered any bugs and its absolutely great and playable in it's current state. [strike]The player classes are simple, just Goalie, Defender, Midfield and Forward, instead of being more specific. For me, it's a plus but someone might be also wishing for those. [/strike] They added more advanced classes in a HUGE update and I was wrong, I prefer it this way.

 I also found out the default match is just too short for my liking but you can customize that in the league settings. However, I haven't found a way to change it mid-season/career so I'm pretty sure it is impossible. Kind of forced me to start a numerous new games to find the perfect lenght for me. There are also other options you can customize, i.e. no injuries, no fatigue, unlimited cash etc but these do disable achievements. [strike]Also there is no external difficulty settings I've come across[/strike] While there still aren't difficulty options per se, you can enable "hard mode."


My only complaint is that I hope the game would extend the time as long as the ball is in penalty zone. In real Soccer if you're basically still on offense, the perioid won't be whistled over. This would make late-perioid corner kicks way more interesting imo, since defenders need to actually clear the ball or get it to goaltender. But this is just my opinion and not a flaw per se.

I don't often write reviews on steam, in fact this is my second one. I feel like this small developer deserves one, and a positive at that. If you're unsure, [b]try the demo[/b].

TL;DR Amazing. Reminds me of XCOM. After the new update, I'd have to say its even more amazing.

31351721.review: A good example of Early Access games done right. The devs have been actively updating the game and often ask the community for feedback. Taking inspiration from games of other genres (like XCOM with its various skills and classes) could sound like a risky goal, but Football Tactics has achieved it. In some ways it has been so successful at this that players don't need to follow the actual sport to enjoy Football Tactics. Initially I had a flickering graphics issue with some of the in-game screens but was able to fix it (which was straightforward after searching the steam forums for solutions) by opening the config.exe file under SteamApps > common > Football Tactics, going to "Troubleshooting" and just ticking the box called "Fix missing or flickering fonts, buttons etc".

31335580.review:
Considering nowadays gaming industry where barely a day passes without another early access or AAA scandal Football Tactics suddenly comes along to remind us of better days where developers created games out of passion and excitement for video games! 

The asking price of 15$ for this indie title is in my eyes almost too low, especially when I look at their crazy character creation editor which easily trumps many modern AAA games! In fact, there are so many options that I stopped bothering with getting through them all at some point to finally start playing the freaking game :). Steam Workshop has also alrdy many mods to get around license restrictions or in other words mods which override fantasy names in favor of RL football clubs and players! 

Like in XCOM have your protagonists the chance to learn many different special abilities to achieve your goals as a football club.. Your players have besides special abilties attributes like accuracy, defence, passing or ball control and it's up to you to use the right ability & right attribute at the right time, basically like XCOM in soccer jerseys.. 

There are minor issues here and there like the occasional line of second language type of english or insecure AI. It is, however still an EA indie title which tries to do an honest job and I applaud them for that! 

The only thing I should warn you about is that Football Tactics isn't a hardcore sport managament simulation nor a hardcore tactics game! The mix makes this game a decent casual experience!

I'll let you know when I stumble over anything that might interfere with my recommendation in the future.
31335580.developer_response:
Thanks for the review. Just a note: you will see more depth in the higher leagues. Master using skills and they will make a difference. You will be able to win much stronger opponents.

PS the next update will add a lot to the game's tactics

31291637.developer_response: Возможно, проблема в том, что мы объясняем основы игры, а остальное даем игрока исследовать самим. Начните, пожалуйста, новую кампанию. Сразу же поставьте всех футболистов изучать навыки (к следующему сезону у каждого будет один навык). Научитесь использовать навыки, так как успешное применение навыка через оппонента дает +1 бонусное действие, что позволяет обыгрывать тактически более сильных оппонентов. И обращайте внимание на стоимость ваших футболистов. Продавайте старых, покупайте молодых. Чем больше футболист играет в основе, тем выше интерес к нему от других клубов. Наличие изученных навыков значительно увеличивает стоимость футболистов. Покупайте на трансферах дешевых перспективных игроков. Для начала - тактика выращивания и продажи талантов - отличнейший источник доходов. Надеюсь, вы поиграете еще и измените свое мнение

31235067.review:
[b]Football Tactics 4/5:[/b] [i]Fotbal nemá logiku.[/i] To si ukrajinští vývojáři evidentně nemyslí, když se ho rozhodli zpracovat formou tahové strategie, kde chtě nechtě logika své místo má. Soupeři se střídají po kolech a každé kolo se skládá ze tří akcí. K tomu různé schopnosti a vlastnosti fotbalistů na obou stranách a o zábavu je postaráno. Nápad za všechny prachy, jeho převedení do praxe už však za všechny prachy nestojí. Což ani náhodou neznamená, že by to nebylo i tak nebylo sakra dobré.

 Koncept samotný je natolik silný a z ranku „jednoduše geniální, geniálně jednoduchý“, že to přebije i mnohé problémy. Nejvíce tomu bývala vyčítána malá variabilita. Po pár utkáních se to zvrhlo do stejného průběhu, kdy bylo vše odvislé na tom, zda se vám ta jedna dvě pečlivě připravované akce podařily či ne. To nesporně byla pravda, ale tvůrci na tom zapracovali a takto již pěkných pár měsíců pravda není. Navíc jde stále o předběžný přístup. A v tomto ohledu jde o ukázkový přístup ze strany tvůrců; časté updaty, úzký kontakt s komunitou co se nápadů a změn týče či aktivní modérská komunita skrze Steam Workshop (čili nepřítomnost licencí tím pádem není problém). Navíc hra samotná je již cca rok hotova; pilují se pouze detaily; kupříkladu pencle jsou stále "poněkud divné". Druhý vyčítaný aspekt je, že se to při delších seancích přejí. To sice pravda je, ale nejde o Football Manager, kde trávíte (desítky) hodin na jeden zátah. Tohle je určené k odehraní několika mála utkání jednou za čas. A v tomto módu to funguje bezezbytku. Vyčítat tomu, že manažerská omáčka mimo zápasy samotné je až příliš ochuzená sice lze, ale otázkou je, zda cokoli více už by hru neposouvalo někam trochu jinam. Sám bych to jen a pouze ocenil, ale chápu, proč to tu nemá své místo. A ano, nesporně kvůli všemu výše zmíněnému to jednou bude jako dělané pro tablety; v malých intenzivních dávkách, na tahy, lehce uchopitelné, přitom chytlavé a plné možností.

 Největší problém je tedy paradoxně v tom, že se v tom stále skrývá ohromný potenciál a vyloženě z toho čiší, kudy se šlo vydat dále. Jenže tvůrci po některých cestách jít nehodlají. A tak třeba nelze pracovat v rámci akcí/tahů s rychlostí míče, hra (až na animace) nebere v potaz hru vzduchem čili se nikdy nedostanete do situace, kdybyste před sebou měli padající odražený míč a bylo jen na vás, zda byste investovali jednu akci do jeho zpracování či akci pošetřili a zkusili ho napálit na první dobrou, branková konstrukce nehraje žádnou roli čili tyč nikdy nedáte, nelze úmyslně zakopnout míč do zázemí při potřebě střídání/přerušení hry, nelze v zoufalství nakopnout nazdařbůh mičudu přes celé hřiště v bláhové naději na vyrovnání a tak se vám klidně může stát, že na konci zápasu máte sice míč, tři akce a potřebu vsítit branku, ale jste tak daleko od soupeřovi brány, že není šance se k ní dostat a vypálit apod.

 Detaily? Nesporně, ale právě podobné detaily iritují tím více, čím více času v tom utopíte. A i navzdory výše uvedenému v tom lze utopit času nepočítaně, jelikož základní koncept sám o sobě prostě a jednoduše neoddiskutovatelně chytlavý a zábavný je. A to tak že opravdu (ale opravdu) hodně.

 [b][i]PS po čase:[/i][/b] Tvůrci komunitě vytrvale a pozorně naslouchají a tak mnohé výše uvedené výtky již neplatí. A tak lze nyní plnohodnotně centrovat do výskoku na hlavičku, přibyla zónová obrana, míč může opustit hrací plochu čili hrají roli auty i výkopy, máte ještě více volnosti, co i kam s ním apod. Navíc ostatní týmy se vyvíjí v průběhu sezóny, upravují taktiku v zápase, byly rozšířeny manažerské aktivity mimo zápasy a... No prostě je toho habaděj a pěkný veletucet vylepšení je ještě na dohled.

31223158.review:
Creo que la idea del juego es muy buena, hacer un juego de fútbol por turnos añadiendo la propia gestión del club. Sin embargo, se queda bastante corto en todos los aspecto:

Pros:

- La dificultad es bastante adecuada, al principio cuesta ir ganando partidos y cuando subes de categoría notas la diferencia y sufres por mantenerte, pero es lo divertido de un juego de gestión.

- Hay bastante ligas y equipos "reales" (no tiene el nombre original pero se conocen). Podrían aumentar un poco la variedad de nombres, tenían cuatro jugadores con el mismo.

- El menú es bastante intuitivo y simple, que muchas veces es lo que se pide a estos juegos, un poco más de simpleza.  

contras:

- Los partidos son muy básicos y para mi gusto, demasiado cortos. Tienes tres movimientos para subir el balón y chutar o aguantar la bola, con lo cual la estrategia es bastante escasa y si no tienes buenos jugadores, es imposible meter un gol.

- La simulación es muy limitada. No puedes realizar ningún ajuste ni hay una pequeña retransmisión. Tan solo puedes realizar cambios en el descanso.

- El crecimiento de los jugadores podría ser diferente. Todos crecen por igual, tan solo varia la diferencia de edad.

Dicho esto, entiendo que es un juego en desarrollo y yo realmente amorticé la inversión. Daré mi voto positivo pese a que pienso que hay mucho por mejorar.

30381493.developer_response:
I just want to mention what is not true in the review:

- The matches last at least 48 turns (without added time). Each turn consists of 3 actions. Also, players can make the matches to last longer when starting a new campaign. When you learn how to use skills, the matches become very tactical and dynamic. The Amateur league is kind of tutorial so it's very easy and not tactical.

- That's true that the management part is not very big. However, even in its current state, it gives you the fun of tactical and strategical building your team. The next updates will bring much much more depths in the team building but even now it has a lot of depth to consider. 

Hope you will play more and see what I'm talking about

30340102.developer_response:
I might be wrong, but usually, we hear such reviews when players haven't mastered the skills. When you understand how they work and how to use them tactically, you will see that there is a lot of depth. Because the skills allow your weak team to beat much stronger opponents.  

It doesn't neglect the Simulation, though. But when you use the skills, the simulation just allows you to simulate the matches which aren't important.

If you give the game another chance, use please these tips:
So if you give the game another chance, I'd give you some tips:

1) At the first turn after kick-off, the skills do not work because players are concentrating
2) Learn new and upgrade learned skills on the trainings. It's very important
3) Skills give you +1 bonus action when successfully used _against_ an opponent
4) Kick on the goal as close to the opponent's goal as possible
5) If the chances to score are low, use power shot to get some chance of having a corner
6) Pay attention to your footballers' price. The longer they play in the main team, the higher interest of the other clubs is, and so the higher their price
7) Before every match, look at the opponent's formation and change your formation to use your strong sides and opponent's weak sides

Good luck!

30122331.review:
Однозначно рекомендую. Есть возможность ознакомиться с бесплатной демо-версией. Лично я скачал демку и понял, что обязан приобрести эту игру. Можно играть в режиме карьеры, делая клуб любительской лиги лучшим клубом Европы, можно играть вдвоем с другом на одном компьютере, можно и по сети. Системные требования не высокие, без проблем идет на ноутбуке 2008 года выпуска. Есть несложный в усвоении редактор лиг, команд, игроков. Это для тех, кого не устраивают вымышленные названия клубов и игроков. Плюс некоторые умельцы в стиме сделали ряд лиг для игры, с реальными клубами и игроками. 
В общем, игра для любителей футбола и тактических стратегий. На стадии раннего доступа, но это совершенно не мешает процессу полного залипания, и ранний доступ - это большой плюс. Значит, что впереди нас ожидает еще много интересного.

30103124.review:
Juego creativo, estrategico y divertido. Desde 3ra division hasta 1ra division de élite, he pasado horas jugando a este juego, como maximo, pediria comentaristas, pero eso es lo de menos. Es un juego en el que apenas encuentras fallos, tiene lo justo, no hace falta quitar ni añadir nada, a pesar de algunas mejoras en las fisicas.

Los 15 Euros mejores gastados.

30076587.review:
Avis depuis la version 10.

Ce jeu était prometteur au moment de la Beta, aujourd'hui, toutes les modifications apportées ont ruinés le jeu, les compétences des joueurs ne servent plus à rien, tellement il existe des effets de jeu qui vous les annules, les lancé de dés CPU/Joueur sont toujours à l'avantage de l'ordi, l'IA est complètement cheatée a ce niveau, les matchs sont maintenant soporifiques, il est devient quasis impossible d'avoir des occasions de but et quand vous parvenez à tirer, votre tireur doit réussir un ensemble de 2 à 3 jets de D qui sont de toutes façons toujours à l'avantage de l'ordi. Sur une suite de 6 matchs, j'ai obtenu 6  ... 0 - 0 avec de chaque coté 0 - 0 occasion de buts, du n'importe quoi ! 


bref vous l'aurez compris, comme on dit, a vouloir en faire de trop, on va trop loin, le jeu s'est ruiné de lui même alors qu'il était prometteur. 



Avis précédent : Vraiment un chouette jeu, quand j'étais gosse j'avais un jeu de foot de "société" que j'adorais, très simple, se jouant aux dès, et je retrouve le même plaisir avec celui-ci. On est loin de l'animation d'un vrai match de foot, mais ce jeu est plus tactique qu'il y parait, surtout après quelques heures de jeux. Au début, on se contente de passes et de tirs, ensuite, on se rends vite compte que les compétences sont très importantes, une fois en ligue 1, il est impératif de mettre sa formation en fonction de celle de l'adversaire, bien observer les stats des adversaires et leurs compétences pour savoir comment contrer ces joueurs et mettre en place nos meilleurs joueurs en fonction des faiblesses de chaque équipe rencontrée.
Le positionnement est très importants les matchs sont court, on a droit a 4 tours par mi-temps, ce qui laisse peut de marge de manoeuvre et donc savoir a l'avance ce qu'on veut faire, il arrive de devoir changer le positionnement rapidement car on a laisse un trou dans la formation que l'IA exploite. Vraiment un bon jeu, qui mérite de s'y intéresser.

C'est en étudiant correctement la stratégie que je me maintiens dans la première partie de tableau de ligue 1 avec une équipe de 2,5 étoiles. Même au niveau des entrainements, j'ai boosté mes milieux de terrain en Défense afin qu'ils coupent plus souvent les lignes de passe et j'ai booste les compétences Controles de mes attaquant au détriment de la précision pour temporiser efficacement et ça marche, la plupart des buts étant marqué grâce aux combinaisons de talents Tir Canon et Coup de Sombrero. Vu qu'avoir un joueur de précision a plus de 100 points ne garanti rien, puisque les jets de dé IA ne sont pas équilibrés.

Et avec les annonces de la prochaine update, et les nouveautés stratégiques présentées, il me tâte que cela sorte, bien comptant d'avoir profité de l'accès anticipés. 

Gros défaut par contre, les actions se jouent trop sur un résultat de dés qui n'a rien d'aléatoire sur les matchs importants,c'est à dire les matchs de dernier carré de coupe et contre les adversaires qui ont deux étoiles de plus,  l'IA étant vachement avantagé sur les résultats dans ces matchs et je trouve dommage de devoir cheater l'ia pour avoir de la difficulté a l'image de ce que fait une autre licence de jeu de foot que j'ai abandonné justement a cause de cela. 

J'espère que l’algorithme de calculs des actions sera rééquilibré, car passer 10 saisons pour avoir un buteur avec 115 de précision pour qu'il ne sorte jamais une valeur supérieur a 30 dans ses frappes c'est frustrant, surtout que l'ia avec un joueur de ce niveau nous sort des frappes a 80 minimum 6 fois sur 10. C'est comme l'ia qui égalise très souvent sur une action qui suit un but 9 fois sur 10 en coupes qui démontrent plus une volonté de programmation que d'un hasard.
Tout comme les Corners, 90% des frappes puissantes de l'IA dévient la balle en coup de coin, chose beaucoup plus rare quand ce sont nos joueurs qui font des frappes puissantes..

Bref, juste pour moi, cette problématique de lancé de dés IA à revoir...

J'attends la suite, continuez de faire du bon travail, ce jeu a vraiment du potentiel :)

EDIT : Je confirme que si Football tactics veut se faire une place parmis les jeux intéressants, changez le cheat IA .. depuis que je suis en Champions league laissez tomber, les résultats de dés sont du n'importe quoi. Même les compétences de niveau 3 contre des adversaires sans les contre-compétences, ca passe jamais ... C'est limite se moquer des joueurs sur ce coup !

30032400.review:
A simplistic little turn based Blood bowl game. Doesn't require a lot of thinking, but there is enough strategy here for the price with regards buying players, contracts and player formations. 

After that it's all dice rolls. I'm not sure how frustrating it could be just "going through the motions" earning enough cash to get better players - there's no club management/advertising (etc), or any 1 time "pop up decisions" that could change the game enough to keep it varied.

After getting promoted you are just waiting for cash every game. Maybe worth £5-6.

EDIT: I have over 60hrs on this. You can just fire up a game, and play for 5 mins and quit again. Fun to pass the time, and you can play 1-handed if you are bottle feeding a newborn.

30013433.review:
WOW !
If you are old enough to fondly remember the original Football Manager by Kevin Toms then this will take you right back there.
Naturally, it's a bit more elaborate but the basic idea is still there. The beauty of this game is it's simplicity. Enabling new players to quickly get to grips with the mechanics. 
Slowly progressing up through the ranks you will be enthralled & at times downright annoyed by those 'shock' results. Nonetheless you will progress each season & eventually lift those trophies.
Althoigh i said 'slowly progressing' , you can finish an entire season on an hour or two. For me, that means many seasons can be completed in a day.
I love this game.........10 / 10.

Impression following latest update.....
Love the extra strategy which is added & it's not too complicated or over-involved like most footy management games nowadays.
Personally, i prefer to play with 'Simulated results' ( Quick game ). Only problem is the frequency of red cards, especially during cup matches. These can totally screw your season.

Very happy to have this in my library :))

Tipp Kick Strategie mit Manager vereint.
Die herkömlichen aktuellen Fussballmanager Spiele sind mir alle mitlerweile zu aufwendig und umfangreich und gefallen mir nicht mehr.Dort dauert es eine Ewigkeit und soviel Zeit hat kaum noch jemand heutzutage.Dieses Spiel ist genau richtig für zwischendurch aber auch für längere Zeit.Spannende Taktik mit guter Werte und Zufallsberechnung und toller Fussballmanager Eigenschaft.Der Kauf hat sich gelohnt und das alles zu einem fairen Preis.

29958665.review:
Bester Fussballmanager zu Zeit! Sehr straight, nicht überladen, macht riesigen Spaß zu spielen und erinnert an die besten Zeiten der Ascaron-Games. Unkompliziert, bekommt mit der Zeit Tiefe, innovatives Spielsystem.

FT ist ein wenig an das RTS Prinzip angelehnt. Wie bei einem rundenbasierten Spiel hat man pro Spielzug 3 Zugmöglichkeiten, bei der man sein Spiel entwicklen, Tore schießen oder dem Gegner den Ball abnehmen kann. Die Spieler entwickeln sich weiter und können bestimmte Fertigkeiten erlernen.

Stadionausbau, neue Trainer und andere Erweiterungen sind möglich, allerdings ohne dass man dafür einen Wochenendkurs für das Spiel absolvieren müsste.

Die Gesichter der Spieler kann man wohl anpassen, habe ich aber noch nicht probiert. 

Einen Nachteil hat das Spiel: man kann sehr schlecht aufhören, es zu spielen. Ein Spieltag geht immer noch. 

Unbedingte Empfehlung!

29843997.review:
One of the games I've had most fun with. 
There are so many positive reviews recommending the game and giving the details of the gameplay. I would like to just add some advice for a better gameplay. I dont know if the developer agrees with me, but:

- Goalkeeping should be a seperate ability other than acc, pass, def, and ctr. Both GK and DF depend on the same ability: defense. So, you can play a GK in DF position, or vice versa. (I know there is a "penalty for playing on other position" option when starting the game, but after playing a couple of seasons the AI teams start to play GKs on DF positions, and they are as good as DF players).

- I think it would be better to have "highlighted tiles" with different color than green. Pitch is already green. (Also the tile color can change according to the skill that can be executed on that tile. As an example, the tiles that an MF can pass/loft pass have different color than he can layoff pass.) 

- It would be better to see a statistics screen of footballers (games played, goals, assists, yellow/red cards, etc.) at the end of the season (or anytime we want)

29808202.review: Hands down one of the best games, developers keep up good work.

29776028.review:
This game is great - A simple football management game without the endless tedious micromanagement of the usual football games.

I love the tactics side.  It seems overly basic at first, but the longer the game goes on, the more the possibilities open up. 
At first I would just punt the ball up to my best striker and hope for the best.  But now I'm finding myself running the ball down to the corners to cling on to a 1-0 lead - or pinballing the ball around in midfield to get the other team out of position.

Although it is early access, it has no issues that i've come across (although a bit more depth & detail would improve things a bit).   

Games are balanced - no stupid 10-0 games - and once you get the hang of using the special skills you can produce some magic on the pitch every now and then (yes i've punched the air on occasion).

29744157.review: 玩了两天，从最低级别联赛一路上来，现在拿到了两个联赛冠军，一个杯赛冠军。球队评星达到了4.5星。基本后面只剩下AOFA杯和亚洲杯了。虽然游戏比较简单但是容易上瘾。FM外较少能这么上瘾的足球游戏了。强烈推荐！

29688565.review:
Игра классная и разработчики не душные. Если вы не влюбились с первого кадра геймплея в игру, все впорядке - попробуйте бесплатную демку. Я после первого матча понял, что нужно покупать.

Создавая одиночную игру решил, что будет занятно включить хардмод ("сложное начало"). Хотя в игре не заметил обычного переключателя уровня сложности, хардмод делает игру намного сложнее - вместо заранее прокачанных хомячков в начале у вас команда игроков 0 уровня. С одной стороны, конечно интересно, но с другой, пока я не прокачал симуляциями их до 20 уровня, играть было довольно раздражающе. К 30 сезону наконец удалось взять Премьер Лигу и ачивку "Герой" (хардмод). 

Игра очень интересна сама по себе, пошаговая ролевая стратегия про футбол - ну когда вы в такое играли? К тому же, если вы как я, часто мечтали о чем-то МЕЖДУ Football Manager и FIFA - то вот, это оно. 

У игры есть минусы, которые хотелось бы исправить. Например, отсутствие возможности продажи игроков на трансферном рынке. В окне трансферов можно купить игроков, цены на них очень разняться, при чем за 60 уровень скилла в разное время могут требовать очень разные цены. Но вашего игрока 60 уровня вы можете продать только по одной цене, которая еще и к тому же гораздо ниже, чем средняя рыночная. 

Также, в онлайн-режиме очень трудно найти случайного соперника. За 2 дня поисков так ни с кем сыграть не удалось.

В остальном же, удивительно интересная спортивная стратегия в которую хочется возвращаться.

P.S. Хотелось бы версию для Mac и Android.
