18464351.review:
Its more than 2 years later. Time for a small update to my review! I'll keep the old one below, as a reminder to myself some game developers actually know what they're doing when improving a title beyond its initial promise.

First off, the turn based tactics is still key to the enjoyment. Somehow they've made it really work for a title like this, and I re-iterate how fresh it feels to the stale and frustrating 3D animations of other series. The fact that you get to play out your formation and choice tactically through the game day is so much fun, and this game has all other game beat when it comes to depth. You'll get the actual calculations, you'll understand why you concede and score goal, and you'll probably not feel like the game is unfairly punishing you without explanation when you suddenly trip out in a 1-5 defeat after a series of wins.

It's just sooooo much better than a certain other title. If you enjoy chess or X-Com or Civilization or just any form of turn based tactics you can't go wrong with this. I would even say you don't even need to enjoy "soccer". The abstraction of the match day into pieces on a chess board with limitations to actions and movement, is enjoyable for anyone with heart for tactics. This title gets two thumbs up from this "PC-masterrace guy" and I hereby lift the "embargo" on it as being a mobile phone title. It really isn't anymore. 2 years of improvements and the inclusion of more tactical choices and speciality classes, have brought the match engine to a state of near perfection.

Updated con/pro list:

Pros:
-Game expands its mechanics as you play, so it will never feel overwhelming for a new player
-Rewarding skill progression on players
-Surprisingly decent animations and overall aestethics
-2017: match engine depth. Tactics feel really rewarding, and you can go full Magnus Carlsen on the game and be rewarded for it. You'll start losing "easy" matches if you think you'll cakewalk thru' anyone.
-2017: Its actually as fun to be struggling as it is to be a top team.
-2017: The RNG factor is on the money.(its minimal) I've never felt arbitrarily punished in this game after the latest updates. 
-Has that "just one more turn" feeling which all good turn-based games need.
-2017: The AI is tough to the point of perfection. Its hard to make it trip up.

Cons:
-Lack PC-gaming masterrace depth. (the 20+ years of headstart from the CM/Football Manager series when it comes to Transfer Market, Player Database, Stats, News, Random events, etc... Basically this game has all that CM/Football Manager does wrong right, and vice versa. Often to no fault of their own.)
2017 update: Still applies, there's some basic functions, but this game is still all about match day. But at least you can finish a season in one sitting.

-Matches feel a bit "short" or like your managing a little league game. 
2017 update: No longer applies. There's a setting now to increase length. I'm at the point where I wish that was even longer, but thats just me being greedy. They've managed to get the game to a point where even with extra turns for each half, that doesn't mean you'll get insane results. I still wind up in 2-1 wins and 0-1 defeats.

-Tactics might feel gimmicky if you are looking for realism. 
2017: They do indeed. But this is just a con if you despise chess or turn based gaming. 

-2017 con: Hard mode isn't balanced yet. 
-2017 con: Game still looks like a mobile phone game in its presentation. Which is fine for now, but if they want a sequel, they need to rework the UI.
***

2015 original review:
So I usually despise iOS games being sold over steam since Im PC-Masterrace.
I also despise the modern gaming industry for pandering to the lowest common denominator when it comes to game complexity
The last game I gave a passing grade in modern times was Mount and Blade:Warband(I was tempted to say Jagged Alliance 1.13...)
I've played Championship Manager since the 93/94 version on glorious MS-DOS, and I've despised that series since 2003, mostly due to the fact that it gives no proper feedback anymore to whether you won or lost due to player intervention or just hidden RNG mechanics. (that is actually hardwired to f*** you over to no fault of your own if you get a winning streak)

I friggin' LOVE THIS GAME. Sure, its iOS, sure its modern gaming developers, but it actually got working complexity hidden beneath its shell.
Oh, and ofcourse its actually more rewarding to play than any of the modern Football Manager iterations, which has lost all its gaming appeal. Why this is? Because the game will actually reward and show you that YOUR changes actually made a difference in the game.

Turn based mechanics is the way to go for football managers, since Eidos/EA or whoever shitcompany is making that crap series doesn't realize that they are making a football manager GAME, not a football match simulator where every aspect of the gaming mechanics is hidden under the hood for nobody to ever see.

Pros:
-Game expands its mechanics as you play, so it will never feel overwhelming for a new player
-Rewarding skill progression on players
-Surprisingly decent animations and overall aestethics
-Has that "just one more turn" feeling which all good turn-based games need.

Cons:
-Lack PC-gaming masterrace depth. (the 20+ years of headstart from the CM/Football Manager series when it comes to Transfer Market, Player Database, Stats, News, Random events, etc... Basically this game has all that CM/Football Manager does wrong right, and vice versa. Often to no fault of their own.)
-Matches feel a bit "short" or like your managing a little league game.
-Tactics might feel gimmicky if you are looking for realism.

18187531.review:
Very cool game where you incorporate and then manage a soccer team from a grass-roots amateur club to a world class Premier League team. The management aspects of the game are simplified in contrast to simulation games that focus on that aspect alone, yet the experience is engaging and addictive. Games play out over the course of just a few minutes. These involve manipulating players in a turn based strategic mini-game where decision making, player stats and good old fashioned RNG dictate outcomes in equal part.

Just one more turn/game/season. Minutes turn into hours. Very clever game.

9/10

18153975.review: Do you like Football Manager for deep management simulation, but wish there was a (much) simpler option? Do you like playing soccer games, like FIFA, but wish you could focus more on strategy rather than execution? If so, you'll probably enjoy this game. I love it! I wish it had more stat-tracking and history (e.g., career stats, hall of fame), but I think some of that will come in the future. As-is, it's a ton of fun, as long as you like your sports games heavier on strategy and light on graphics, action. When playing it, I feel like I'm playing a game of chess with my opponent. Moving players without the ball, luring defenders out of position, holding the ball and running out time. Except for the first league you start it, you won't win much by simply poundng the ball forward and shooting. You have to use trickery and deception to get your opponent to make a mistake and allow you a clear opportunity at goal. I recommend this game even in its early access form. I can't wait to see what the developers add in the future!

18143601.review:
Очень неплохая идея - объединить футбольный менеджер с пошаговым симулятором матчей. Давно искал подобную игру, и эта оправдала большую часть надежд. Те, кто знает, что такое футбол, футбольные тактики и т.п. найдут очень много параллелей с реальностью. В игре присутствует довольно не плохое тактическое разнообразие, хотя и хочется еще большего)
Из минусов - на мой вкус, матч коротковат по количеству ходов, хотя при подавляющем перевесе можно достичь и счета 6-0 (у меня есть один такой матч).
На мой вкус, слишком большой бонус вратарской площадки, сильного вратаря обыграть очень сложно. В общем, есть некоторые шероховатости балланса, а в целом - очень не плохо.

18102956.review:
Great casual game!

You can customize your team, the experience progression makes you care for them and then you sell your best players for outrageously high amounts of money ;)

The old football manager just-one-more-match-itch is very much there...

It's still in Early Access though, so expect some (minor) issues: The most annoying thing I found was that the indicators for the outcome of a turn would show before the players actually moved on the pitch, thus killing the suspense of watching them. Though once you've gotten the hang of the mechanics and attributes you can toggle the indicators off in the options.

18085858.review:
Malgré toutes ses qualités, et il en a suffisament pour que j'ai insisté sur plusieurs saisons, ce jeu ne m'a pas convaincu.

Malheureusement la première impression est assez mauvaise et je crains que de nombreux joueurs n'aillent pas assez loin pour voir le contenu réel du jeu et ses subtilités. En effet on démarre avec une équipe amateur dont les joueurs sont faibles et sans compétence et le budget ridicule. Ce qui fait que, d'une part, les matches qui se jouent par suite de 3 coups, se résument à un genre de baby-foot sans autre technique que 2 passes et boum, d'autre part cela prend un temps fou de développer le club avec des outils de mnagement hyper-simplifiés. Le marché des transfert est un  simple achat-vente sur un choix limité et imposé, les entrainements sont quasi-inutiles puisque les joueurs progressent dramatiquement peu dans les premières divisions. Concrètement il faut 4 ou 5 saisons pour s'apercevoir que c'est beaucoup plus élaboré que ça en a l'air :
- même si on reste loin du vrai football, le moteur de match offre quelques actions type comme les corners et les coup-francs,
- la valeur des joueurs dépend de leur utilisation,
- on peut recruter des staffs qui améliorent la liste de transfert et l'entrainement
- les joueurs ont des capacités spéciales, petit pont ou interception par exemple, qui permettent de gagner un coup supplémentaire,
- la fatigue et la récupération sont prises en compte,
- les joueurs ont peu de caractéristiques et à priori une seule est critique pour chaque poste mais en réalité définir notre style de jeu va demander des joueurs complémentaires et/ou polyvalents,
- la renommée acquise permet de d'attirer de meilleur staff, de prolonger des joueurs en fin de carrière, de les aider à apprendre des compétences.

On s'aperçoit donc à l'usage que Football Tactics est beaucoup plus sophistiqué qu'il n'y parait au premier abord.

Mais, mais... tout celà implique de longues heures à monter les divisions et la nécéssité de faire les bons choix de développement du club sous peine de galèrer encore plus longtemps. Et c'est là la faiblesse du jeu par rapport à ce que j'en attendais. A ne pas vraiment choisir entre la tactique et le management, on a un produit un peu bâtard qui n'est vraiment bon ni dans un domaine ni dans l'autre et qui demande un investissement temps disproportionné par rapport à ce que son look d'appli smarphone laissait augurer. 
en bref, ce qui m'a vraiment déplu :
- le management bien qu'abordant de nombreux domaines est simplifié au point qu'il n'a plus rien d'immersif,
- la tactique est frustrantre parce que le peu d'actions possibles fait qu'au final on a plus l'impression de gagner ou perdre sur les tirages que sur notre façon de jouer,
- on n'a aucun contrôle sur ce que l'on va recruter : que ce soit les jeunes (vous pouvez tirez plusieurs gardiens d'affilée, qui plus est avec des compétences d'avant-centre ou de milieux), ou la liste des transferts que le staff établit comme bon lui semble, il n'y a aucun moyen de chercher un joueur au profil précis.
- la logique du "seuls ceux qui jouent s'améliorent" est poussé à l'extrème sur ce jeu, les choix d'entrainement ne servent qu'à orienter les gains en match, si vous voulez former des jeunes faites les jouer ! Bon ce n'est pas trop pénalisant dans l'absolu puisque, vu le moteur de match, il suffit d'avoir 1 ou 2 bons joueurs par ligne mais ça ne me plait pas.

Edit : depuis la rédaction de cette évaluation le jeu a un peu évolué et offre désormais plusieurs slots de sauvegarde => paragraphe correspondant supprimé. Je maintiens cependant l'évaluation négative, avec du recul ce jeu me parait vraiment très loin du foot et finallement assez pauvre tactiquement comme stratégiquement en regard de son prix (surtout qu'il semble s'éterniser en EA).

17993591.review:
Football Tactics:
~~~~~~~~~~~~~
   
Always wanted to find out how the top coaches made it all the way to the Premier League? Well, don’t look further, they are all playing Football Tactics!!

Football Tactics is a football manager game using a turn-based system during match day which gives this game its originality.

First you will have to choose which team and in which country you will be playing. Then, the Amateur League will start. This league is realistically a tutorial and will help you to understand how to play the game and you will probably find it quite easy. As soon as you move up to the next league, the difficulty will increase straight away and you will be facing tougher opponents. In total, you have 5 leagues and 2 cups to play in and the aim is to reach and win the Premier League and the Cups, of course.

The management aspect of the game has good depth but it is easy to use and understand. I really like it that way. You can . . . upgrade your stadium to get more attendance and revenue, upgrade your youth academy so you can find better young talents, purchase new players during the transfer window, get specific coaches and assistants so your players improve their skills (but you will need prestige points). How do you get prestige points, you may ask? Really simple, if the goal difference is  1 in your favour then you will get 1 prestige point. If you manage to finish the season in the top 3 teams, you will be rewarded with additional prestige points. 

Match day – Each half will consist of 24 action moves to be used between each team, with a total of 48 moves per match. Remember, you and your opponent will use 3 action moves per turn. They are plenty of moves to make your mark and score goals. At the end of each match, your player will get experience points which in turn will help them to reach a higher level. If you win, you’ll get higher experience points. 

The graphics are smooth and polished and the game runs well. This game is an early access and it is very impressive so far. Please bring on the full version, I can’t wait!

Positives:
~~~~~~~   

-	Good and easy Football Management 
-	Turn-based match day
-	Really fun to play
-	Addictive and challenging
-	Plenty of achievements

Negative:
~~~~~~~ 

-	No trading cards

9/10 

Key provided by developer/publisher for review purposes. Any opinions expressed are entirely my own!

17970728.review:
Nice idea with a lot of potential, sadly the game at the current state is really one-dimensional and gets boring within an hour. There's no real tactics/strategy, it's all based on luck, and the 3-turn-per-round-rule doesn't allow for anything fancy at all. Plus, as every action takes up minutes, you arithmetically can't win higher than like 3-0, maybe 4-0 if you are really lucky. No real surprises in the game, and nothing that would make you log back in again. - While I gladly gave my $15 for the nice idea and maybe something better in the future, I really can't recommend this game at all to anybody else.

[Edit:] I appreciate the developers answering negative feedbacks/recommendations. While I played the game a tiny bit longer now, I still feel that (a) match times are not long enough, and (b) actions always seem to consume the same amount if game time - I think the game would benefit highly from making actions using up time in certain ranges, aka 1-5 minutes, this would also give some games the feeling of lasting "forever" and others to be rather short - just like in real ilfe. :) - Anyways, for the polite and professional answer I change my recommendation, although I personally do not think this will be my next "big love". Good luck to you guys though!

This game is very interesting and has a lot of potential behind it. The game itself is very fun and feels competitive. I look forward to the multiplayer aspect very much. However this game currently feels like a multiplayer aspect oriented game with single player tacked on as an afterthought. The single player campaign is far too slow for my liking because you need to play every match. While that is fine for the first few matches, it quickly grows old. A simulation feature would make this much better. In adition a fix to the black borders on the edges or at the very least an actual windowed mode would make this game look much better,
As it is I recommend this game due to its creative premise and a potential that seems very achievable, however do not expect Football Manager-esque gameplay or depth just yet. 17646799.review:
I agree 'Football Tactics' is turn-based, but I don't think the word strategy really describes this game.  It is very difficult to build a coherent strategy when you only have 3 available actions every time it becomes your turn. (Moving a player one square counts as an action.) because of this every game plays out in the same way.

- Get the ball
- Pass to striker
- Shoot from outside box

The AI also plays with this same strategy. If it fails, try it again next turn. The game introduced  a few special skills that your players can learn. But often it feels very limited in terms of which skills which player can learn.

Player improvements are incredibly simplistic and within about 30 minutes I'd noticed a flaw in tthe club improvements.

This game may improve, but it would require a radical redesign of the basic gameplay in order to do so.

17627207.review:

This game is really good fun. Obviously because it is early access, it has limits, and I've experienced two crashes so far. But other than this, I love the game. From the goofy animations, to the generic team names, it somewhat reminds me of the "Sensible Soccer" football game. 

If you are in to football, and like strategy based games, this is one for you. Unlike other early access games I have played, I find this to be very immersive and a good bit of fun. Even in the game they mention the new features we can expect soon!

I only have a few improvements in mind, but in all honesty, this is one of my favourite games right now.

17485631.review:
Football tactics is a sort of chess game with football players except for the fact that a lot relies on luck when the dice are rolled. The game starts you off at the bottom league in the chosen country, you have to put up a formation, perhaps buy a few new players and learn the controls.

While luck is definately a huge factor dont forget that each player has individual skills which can be trained as the player levels up, this adds to depth in terms of which options you have on the pitch. A match takes about 3-4 minutes to complete and time just flies away as you need to play just one more game.

Its easy to play and far less complicated than chess, in fact its the light aspect of it which perhaps is the games biggest advantage, everyone can pick it up and have a go. As for the price, given the hours I have use I cant complain.

The devs seem responsive and the beta has many new implementations which improve the game, youth academy, other ways of gaining fame (game currency for certain upgrades). Up to you to give the current release a go or try the beta.

With much room for improvements and balance I still think this is a little gem, if you are a football fan you might love it.

17389894.review:
Joueur assidu de Football Manager depuis plus de 15 ans et aussi amateur de jeux de combat tactique au tour par tour, Football Tactics attisait depuis plusieurs semaines ma curiosité.
Avant de l'acheter, je constate que le prix est tout de même assez disproportionné en constatant une réalisation datée  aussi bien sur les screenshots que sur les vidéos de let's play. 
Ne te laisse pas avoir par cette course au graphisme et à la vacuité, me dis-je. Mieux vaut un jeu moche qu'un beau jeu sans intérêt...

Après achat et quelques heures de jeu, je réalise que j'aurais sans doute dû écouter mon intuition.
Football Tactics n'est pas mauvais, il est même très plaisant pour un jeu à 2€, pour ainsi tuer le temps dans le métro ou le bus.
Attendez un instant ! On me susurre à l'oreille que ce n'est pas un jeu Android ni iOS mais un jeu PC vendu à 13€ !!!
Woooo bah mince, ça fait cher le portage... On me rétorque que ce n'est pas un portage non plus...
Non c'est bien un jeu PC en early access 100% pour joueur élitiste et poilu. Ben dis donc, les critères de qualité ne sont plus les mêmes qu'il y a 10 ans...

En effet, Football Tactics est vraiment sympatoche. Le seul probème est qu'il a la profondeur tactique d'un shooter Ubi et propose autant de variété qu'un jeu de sport d'EA. Bilan, c'est utra répétitif, relativement facile une fois qu'on a trouvé la bonne tactique et surtout aussi vide qu'un modèle 3D de Minecraft.

Je vous le conseille donc vivement en promo à moins de 5€ et en streaming avec une tablette shield à l'aide d'une connection 4g dans les tunnels du métro.
Je salue donc les 8 personnes concernées et leurs souhaite un excellent moment de détente avec Football Tactics.

1ere Note : 3/10 sur PC et à 13€
2eme note : 7/10 sur tablette et à 4€
17389894.developer_response:
Je regrette que vous pensez qu'il n'y a pas assez des tactiques différentes dans le jeu. Il est parce que dans la ligue amateur nous permettons joueurs gagnent facilement, apprenant les bases du jeu. Je vois dans vos réalisations, que vous avez obtenu la plupart du temps avec Precision Shot.

Cependant plus tard dans le jeu afin de gagner les joueurs doivent adapter leurs tactiques pour les adversaires, de trouver leurs propres tactiques avec habileté. Rechercher les footballeurs possédant les compétences qui correspondent à la tactique de l'équipe.

L'analogie avec le monde réel est quand vous êtes dans la ligue inférieure, et vous avez une équipe solide, vos footballeurs va marquer facilement à coups de pied sur le but. Cependant, le plus élevé de la ligue vous jouez dans, plus vous devriez penser à la tactique.

Alors s'il vous plaît, donnez-tactique de football une chance de plus. Jouer au moins à la première ligue. Je suis sûr que vous verrez qu'il est vraiment plus profond qu'il n'y paraît.

17388596.review: Nice game so far. Will only get better! Keep up the good work guys!

17387042.review: fun game, should get better with more additions

17382584.review:
The game puts you in the shoes of the general manager and coach of an amateur football team. Can you lead them all the way to the premier league? 

The team managing is interesting; upgrade your staff and stadium, develop your players or sell them you hire better ones. But the main focus of the game is the turn base matches which is surprinsingly addictive and tactical.

Football tactics has a lot of depth, it rewards the player for doing their "homeworks" before each game. Adapting your formation to your opponent's and using your most relevant players really helps the achieve sucess. That makes for a great stategy game. 

Still in early access, the game is very stable. I mostly used the beta version and it crashed only once in almost 200 hours of gameplay. Had a few minors bugs that I'm sure will be fixed (some of them already are), but nothing serious or gamebreaking.

Recommended for anyone who likes strategy and team management games. Thumbs up Creoteam!

17203892.review:
This game was originally an iOS title, normally when you see that on a Steam review it's synonymous with a bad port and terrible gameplay, not this time. I'm not sure under what circumstances the first iteration of this game folded but I'm glad it's back and that the developers seem to be really trying to make it work this time around. 

GAMEPLAY: Take chess, take football, take a little from strategy games like Blood Bowl and that's what this game is. I've been trying to get into Blood Bowl for quite some time but I find it too obscure and complicated. This has potentially a very rich tactical depth but is at the same time super easy to understand and after a couple matches you'll realize what the best strategies are (once PvP is introduce that depth will turn into a black hole of infinite posibilities). Also, it's nice because it feels like a full fledged turn based experience but every match can be played in a very short amount of time.

INTERFACE: It's super obvious this is a port from a tablet game, but the developer has said they'll eventually introduce widescreen support. Other than that, I'm not bothered at all by the app feel of the interface, it would be awesome if they launched on iOS again and you could continue your league play on the go.

OTHER: In its previous model, this game had a pay mechanic to grant you access to the best players, I never entered the PvP scene because the app crashed all the time and it was super annoying so I didn't inverst into it but that mechanic has been removed (at least until version 0.2). Oh and apparently they are working on Workshop support to personalize the content even further.

To improve until final release:

-Widescreen support
-PvP as soon as possible
-Certain minor bugs here and there (the developers seem active in correcting them though)

My wishlist:

-Local hotseat support
-The ability to play with selected teams already at the top
-Multiple save slots

TL;DR: If you like strategy games and you like football this game is the real deal. Best case scenario, you invest 13 bucks for a game that will eventually become a monster in strategy and sports gaming (the core gameplay certainly has the potential for that). Worst case scenario, the developers give up tomorrow and you invest 13 bucks in an amazing single player experience that even right now is very polished and very addicting.

16959857.review:
EDIT:
Some time has passed, and with the changes done - I think this game requires an updated review - so here it is :).

It's a long review, so if you are discouraged by it - let me start with a SHORT STATEMENT ON WHY IT'S WORTH TO BUY THIS GAME:

It's fun, it's engaging, it pulls you in from the first moment, not to mention the fact that the community and devs are really great. If you like football games, if you like tactical games, if you like games that take a cool new approach to stuff we know and love: buy it! You won't regret it! :)

Oh, and kids - don't forget to sometimes turn off the computer and play some real football outside ;).


ACTUAL REVIEW:

This game is really impressive. For the last two hours I experience a heavy case of "just... one... more... game...". Brilliant.

Football Tactics is fun. In a way that's the only review anyone needs. It's already pretty polished, and quite recently the devs added the options to not only edit names of your players, but also edit and create new Leagues, and publish them with the use of Steam Workshop. Which basically means I will soon publish my own version of Polish clubs :).

The idea of Football Tactics is super simple: manage your club, and play games in a turn-based mode. It's done in a way that is easy to understand and get a grasp on, but at the same time it is complex enough to engage the player.

For me - a football fan, and also a fan of football games - this one is a true gem. I can easily say that there are three football games I play: Football Manager, FIFA (on console) and Football Tactics. And yes - I feel safe mentioning Football Tactics together with those two huge titles. Because it gives me the same pleasure, although in a completely different, new way.

Finally - I am VERY impressed by the developer. Amazingly responsive, very much engaged in the communication with the community (which you can also see below in the comments to my review :) ). My comment on strange names for Polish teams was instantly taken into account, and in following update the names were changed (with just some slight help from me, as I posted the changes in names, that I think should be done).

I love gaming, and I do try many different games, and honestly - I rarely see so much dedication from the dev. It's simply great.

For me this game comes back to the times when the idea and playability were the most important factors. And even though it's "simple" - it's very entertaining, and looks really nice.

I can really recommend it.

16769002.review:
[h1] Piłka nożna jest najważniejszą wśród rzeczy nieważnych. [/h1]

W ostatnich latach można zauważyć problem w grach o tematyce piłkarskiej. Coraz więcej zawiłych opcji, coraz mniej czystej przyjemności z gry. Porównania tej produkcji do Football Managera są nieuniknione. To co mnie osobiście odstrasza od FMa to jego nierealność. Można dopasować perfekcyjną taktykę pod słabego rywala i wysoko przegrać, zero logiki. Twórcy nie słuchają krytycznych uwag graczy, i po rozegraniu kilku tysięcy godzin przez ostatnie lata, mogę jasno stwierdzić że FM się nie rozwija, a kolejne wersje to tylko odcinanie kuponów z tego samego produktu, odrobinę zmienianego graficznie. 

Tymczasem Ukraiński Creoteam stworzył prostą grę, która mimo obecnego early access już teraz wygląda bardzo dobrze. Siłą "Football Tactics" jest jej prostota, strzelenie bramki przy ograniczonej ilości ruchów. Oczywiście gra posiada wiele opcji, całą menedżerską otoczkę, transfery i trenowanie piłkarzy, rozbudowę stadionu, ale interfejs jest bardzo czytelny i intuicyjny, nie ma tutaj przebijania się przez dziesiątki zbędnych okienek jak w FMie. Na wielki plus dla twórców gry, zapisuje ich zaangażowanie. Odkąd dowiedziałem się o Football Tactics śledziłem fora i komentarze graczy. W kilku miejscach poza pochwałami pojawiły się uwagi i rady. I co? Twórcy odpowiadają na takie wpisy i uwzględniają je w rozwoju gry. O ile początkowo gra wydaje się banalna, to z czasem i trudniejszymi rywalami, gracz musi dokonywać właściwych taktycznie wyborów. Długie piłki do napastników czy krótkie podania po ziemi? Rozwój młodych graczy, czy kupno gwiazd? Strzały na siłę, czy techniczne? Każdy wybór niesie konkretny skutek, nie ma jednej właściwej drogi. 

Oceniając tą grę zastanawiałem się nad minusami o których mógłbym napisać, ale ciężko wskazać na jakiekolwiek. Bugów mimo wczesnej wersji jest niewiele, cena jest co prawda spora (12.99 Euro), ale patrząc na rozbudowaną kampanię, możliwości dobierania bonusowych umiejętności do graczy, a także zapowiadany multiplayer, to jest produkcja na długie godziny grania. Gra ma ogromny potencjał i szczerze wierzę że Creoteam tego nie spieprzy.

16646234.review:
Early Access Version 0.2 review:

Let me start by saying I am not much of a football fan at all. I mean I'll follow the world cup highlights, but that's about as far as I go. As far as gaming goes, I last seriously played Footbal Manager on Commodore 64, as later PC versions turned out just too tedious for me.

But then I came across this. And *boom*, I love football again. Well done Creoteam, really well done. Why is it so good? Because it is simple, yet deep. Easy to grasp, but will take cunning and skill to master. 

First I spent an hour deciding on my club's name, fiddling with the colours and jerseys, then it plunges you straight into the competition. Only a few tabs, like the team roster with the basic pitch layout and who you want to play where, the training menu with just a couple options for each player, the buying/selling transfers one, the upgrade one and the league table and calendar. Nothing to get lost in, easy to keep all your players in mind and how to best use them in a game.

And the game? A brilliantly simple concept.  3 actions per turn when you can try to take the ball from the other team, pass it, dribble or shoot. The skill of your player vs. the skill of the opposing player will determine if you will be successful. But whenever you score a goal, you're genuinely happy, because you executed a tactic perfectly.

Even at version 0.2 the game is perfectly playable, the looks and animations are excellent for a simple-graphics game, you'll probably want to turn off the repetitive music after a half an hour, but otherwise it's great fun.

16486692.review:
What a good game this is! I am in my third season, and have been promoted from League 4 to 3 to now to league 2.

I fully expect to get creamed..as I have been taking most of the money I am making and upgrading my stadium. This will allow me, over time, to make even more money, and to be competitive at the higher leagues. 

The tactics feel just about right. There are 24 "turns" per half, and you get three turns to either score, or be forced to give the ball up to the other team. 

There are times when aggressive play and getting shots on goal are more preferred to try to hold onto the ball, or to dribble into the teeth of the defense. It all depends on your opposition, the score, the situation, or how bad you need to win! If you are ahead on aggregate 2-1, in the second leg of the FA Cup (or this games' equivalent), it may be better to play keepaway from the other team.

All things considered..I have a TON of new games, including some excellent AAA titles...and I am playing this one instead! Buy this game. Now. If you're reading this, then this means you are a football fan. If you're a football fan, then simply pull the trigger and buy this game. It looks cheesy and arcadey, but the developers really have a nice vision for this game, and the gameplay is excellent. Buy it. Now.

Le jeu est en early access et je n'ai fait que 2 saisons jusqu'à présent. Un vrai bonheur simple et fun qui me permet enfin de devenir Henri Puel et de faire jouer tous mes fils : Gaston, Luc, Isidore, Lionel, Prune et Félicien. Car, deuxième point très positif : le développeur principal est à l'écoute des joueurs, vient régulièrement répondre au feedback sur le forum Steam et prend en compte les idées applicables tout en expliquant la raison du rejet d'autres souhaits.

Pour le moment certains éléments gachent le plaisir comme des transferts hors de prix et pas assez d'argent gagnés par rapport aux demandes des joeurs pour les prolongations de contrat, mais...ça sera bientôt corrigé.

Les futures implémentations sont également très enthousiasmantes comme un Centre de formation et la possibilité de découvrir pour pas cher la star de demain, ou le hotseat.

En bref : ça fonctionne déjà très bien et le développeur a pris en compte les remarques majeures des joueurs pour rendre le jeu encore plus gratifiant.

To sum up in English : the small flask is early access, but it is printed "play me", so play it :)

16244555.review:
*UPDATED* *11/9/2015*

Football + Chess = Football Tactics. Played for few hours and I really enjoyed it. The depth in the game is quite good. Really makes you think twice before making a move and still can go wrong. Easy to get a grip of the game mechanices. 

Deploying the right players in the right position before starting the match is crucial. Can't change tactics during the match. Also have 3 type of training; attributes, skills and talent. During the match, skills will come handy and gives bonus when the skill performed perfectly. At the same time, players need to have good attributes to pull it off perfectly and even good players make mistakes in late game since their stamina gets low and it affects their attributes. And also after the match, they only recover a bit of their stamina lost each day till the next match and at the same training uses stamina. So its up to you whether you gonna rest the player or play for the next match. Tired player = poor performance. Players also gain experience after a match and level up. Levelling up unlocks skills and talents to be trained. Also have upgrade section; stadium capacity, coaches, assistant, scouts. Like I said, the depth in the game is quite good. 

The developers provided a lot features and in-depth game mechanics for an early access game. Will update my review after few more hours of gameplay. Just wanna see how the game progress.

Verdict: Highly recommended 

UPDATE - 9/6/2015
-------------

After playing about 9 hours, I feel the game has a lot of potential. You can make changes to your tactics in the match but the changes will happen only after an event. Ex: after goal scored. It resets to your new tactic. As the game progress, it gets tough and feels more challenging. I like how the developers let lowest league to be easy. It give players some time to understand how things work and manage things. There are few things need tweaking. Like the chances of getting injured player (went a full season without injury), distribution of "Fame" points after match, expensive players and contract renewals. Developers has been helpful in the community, engaging with the players. Just few bugs here and there, developers promised to fix it in the next update release. 

Verdict: Highly recommended

UPDATE - 11/9/2015
-------------

Playing the game back after the update v0.3. So much improvements to the game mechanics. Addition of weather effects which increases probability of fouls and decreases passing ability, is a an excellent update. Make players to choose proper players for different matches. Injury mechanism is been improved. Players get injured and slowly recovers full stamina. Reward (money and fame points) has been improved. Youth Academy is been added which gives a youth player depending on the current club Youth Academy level, every half season. Better Youth Academy level = Better youth player levels. Now players are cheap to buy and cheap to renew contracts. Stadiums been updated too. Game feels more balanced now. Tiny bits of bugs and errors here and there, nothing major, still an excellent game.

Verdict: Highly rcommended

16186166.review:
Well I always really liked the idea of a Football game (soccer in America) and I actually own quite a few of those games.

But the problem I always had is the management was more of a headache and a bit too complex, and the actual football game (where you watch/play the game) was a bit too boring and drawn out.

This game seems to have found a perfect 'level' of things, at least for me.
The management is just the right amount of complexity where you feel like you are managing your team, but not so much complexity that you're too overwhelmed.

And the games are engaging as you have to manage your 'tactics' ;) to move the ball around and get a goal, and controlling each player in a turn-based fashion and stuff like this is just satisfying all around.

I really look forward to seeing the game grow and develop just a little bit more.
(in particular the multiplayer as well as a few little tweaks to the game that are being mentioned on the forums already)

For those curious how the actual matches work, there are a number of features and things that make it quite nicely complex, without being overwhelming.

Every 'turn' in game is 2 minutes of time that goes by, out of the 45 minutes x2 halves.
Each team gets 3 turns in a row, before passing control to the opposing team, you can end your 3-turn segment early
if you wish.

Each player has different skills, accuracy, control, defense, etc.. and these skills come into play, for example, when 'crossing' an opposing player in a match.
So for example the opponent player has control of the ball.. and you want to take it from him.
So you move your player up adjacent to the opposing player with the ball, using one of your three actions.
Then you attempt to 'wrestle' the ball from him.
Depending on each of your skill in Control, a dice will be rolled for each player, with a maximum possible roll depending on skill.
So for example say the opponent with the ball has a maximum 'potential' roll of 30.
Your 'attacking' player has a maximum potential roll of 25.
You attempt to wrestle the ball, the dice is rolled (in the background, doesn't actually show the dice) then you roll a 25 (lucky) bu the opponent only rolls a 20.. you are successful at wrestling the ball from him, despite having lower skill.
But it was still risky.

With your third and last action you kick the ball towards the goal.
There are several defense men and the goalie in the way.
Each one has a maximum potential to block, and you have your potential to successfully kick.
You roll a 20.. then the first defense player rolls a 15, then the second a 7, then the goalie a 17.
Then that's it, the ball goes through and YOU SCORE!!!

The matches are  engaging, the management is deep but not overly so.
The game is just fun, and I can't wait for MP to be added, cause if done right, will make this game just great.

Dev's are listening to minor issues, and improvements suggestions on the forums, and are very active.

I highly recommend this game if you're looking for a good Football/Soccer experience that's fun and easy to get into,
and possibly have been burned by other Football/Soccer games that were just too boring and un-engaging.

16143662.review:
This is a very fun game. It is simple and elegant yet there is enough depth in the mechanics to provide good satisfication. I've only played the beta demo, just bought the full thing but I played a few seasons in that and the fundamental game mechanics were fun and I can only imagine it being better once I have access to greater amount of skills and management options that the full version allows. There is a real sense of progression and you find yourself invested in your team.

EDIT
Okay I now have 10+ hours under my belt. So I just want to update this. I can confirm that the greater variety of skills as your team progresses increases the depth of the game and I'm still only in Division 2  so I imagine as I unlock some more or get better players that this will continue to increase.

And I stand by my impressions from the beta demo. This is a very clever game design. It's easy to understand mechanics and interface but there is still a good deal of strategy involved.

Now it's still not perfect.

 At the moment, the lowest two divisions are a push over but they have said they are going to update the game with a choice of weaker teams to start with for greater difficulty. It's good in a way because it gives you time to learn the game and it's far from overwhelming. You get hints and concise information game after game in your first season just so you learn the mechanics as you play. It's also not such a problem because the amauter league(lowest league) season is shorter than the higher divisions. That and you get more fame points (which you use to upgrade some aspects of your club) the more you win by so you are still interested in doing well even if the amaetur league doesn't really threaten to win the games.

The AI does the occassional silly thing but it's no where near enough to ruin the experience.

Finally I had my first crash just recently but it was after 10+ hours of play and 3 seasons in so it seems very stable for early access.

I could have talked in more details about why I think the game is so cleverly designed and why this is a gem but this is already going on to long and I just want to be upfront. It's definetely worth the price, even in early access.

游戏虽小，我玩起来很上瘾。
属性不太平衡，射门属性练起来不划算，门将有防守加成，前锋练射门还不如练三级技能和练控球。

希望制作者添加更多游戏内容。

I love football and I love games that combine tactical and strategic elements - this game caters for all the above in a rather addictive 'just one more match...' package.
I've had to make difficult decisions - keep that forward I've been cherishing or sell him to fund another player's contract - and enjoyed them more than in similar games - probably because everything feels very much in your control and very straightforward.

40385472.review:
Tried the demo some time last year, bought the full game about a month ago having honestly forgotten about the demo... I am now in love with this game. It's improved so much.

[b]Pros:[/b]
[list]
    [*]Lightning-fast. You can zip through five seasons in the same time it takes you to play five months of one of the recent Football Manager games.
    [*]You always start off in the lowest league with terrible players and no money, so there's a real sense of progression as you gradually climb the league pyramid
    [*]Highly customisable, both in-game and with Steam Workshop mods
    [*]Graphics are pretty good, with no frame-rate drops
    [*]Updates are relatively frequent, about once a month, and the devs are active in the discussion forums
    [*]One update broke my game and I couldn't proceed without it crashing. I emailed my crash log to the devs and in [i]less than an hour[/i] they patched the bug. [i]Less than an hour.[/i] That's genuinely the most phenomenal customer service I've ever seen from a game developer.
[/list]

[b]Cons:[/b]
[list]
[*]Game hangs for a couple of seconds every time you click "Next", and sometimes it'll hang for a few seconds or the music will cut out for no apparent reason
[*]Your first season can feel kinda "same-y", as you're constantly facing weak opponents with no skills who you can beat 4-0 without even trying (luckily it's a short season, and things open up once you get promoted)
[*]The devs are Russian and their English isn't perfect, but the translation is getting better all the time

I would absolutely recommend this game to anyone who loves football and turn-based strategy. You won't regret it. It's already great and it keeps getting better with each update.

40327295.review:
I tried demo of a game called Football Tactics RPG and wasn't quite sure about it!

It reminded me of a football card game we used to play at work in my early 20's that used a football pitch playing board. Plus this game also a bit like Xcom too  ;)

Anyway like I said wasn't sure about the demo but I played the whole season out. At this point I didn't think it was a bad game but not quite a good game but still there was some thing about the game. It was £12.99 but at the time was £10.99 in a sale. So I thought give it a punt as I'm off sick for 2 months with a almost severed thumb and can't play Fifa or any standard joypad or mouse and keyboard games.

Review 

To get to the point this game it the best football manager game out there. It's better than Football manager because each game is in-depth and you are involved making decisions like a chess game but each game is quick enough to be fun yet packs enough into each game to feel like it was longer.

The game has lots of hidden stuff in tactics and skill moves, there is an art to this game in how you do things. The game is too deep to list everything. 

But the best compliment I can pay to the games depth and strategy is after 50 hours of play I still find computer teams use strategy's I haven't seen before, there's always something new to discover.

If you like football management games and RPG plus Xcom type games then treat yourself to this little gem, you won't regret it.

-dość ciekawy system trików piłkarskich, które uruzmaicają rozgrywkę. W teorii mogłoby to stanoić o niepowtarzalności każdego meczu, stwarzając bogate możliwości wyboru między różnymi opcjami dla ataku i obrony, jednak w praktyce po kilklunastu meczach robi się nudno.

Minusy:
-po kilku godzinach bardzo powtarzalna - sprowadza się do żmudnego grindowania kolejnych poziomów zawodników, sztabu szkoleniowego i stadionu. Ponieważ sama rozgrywka nie wciąga na dłużej sprowadza się to do symulacji kolejnych meczy. i tak sezon za sezonem
-zerwoy potencjał ponownej rozgrywki. Po kilkunastu godzinach grindowania nie ma sensu zaczynać od nowa gdzie rezultat droga do jego osiągnięcia i tak będą takie same.
-tragiczna muzyka, czasami crashuje
-zbyt prosty, a może nawet prostacki, system ekonomii, treningów, szkolenia.

39896530.review:
Absolute Enttäuschung.

Nach knapp 4 Stunden Spielzeit ist weder Spannung noch taktische Tiefe entstanden. Es wirkt wie ein stumpfes Würfelspiel, das problemlos Free2Play im Browser oder gar auf einem Brettspiel laufen würde. Zudem ist es das einzige Spiel in meiner Steambibliothek, dass regelmäßig abstürzt und dabei den ganzen Rechner mitnimmt - Kaltstart garantiert.

Refund wurde nach 4 Stunden Spielzeit abgelehnt trotz Verweis auf Abstürze. Da muss man sich fragen, wozu die Auswahloption im Refund überhaupt besteht.

Hätte ich das alles vorher gewusst, ich hätte es nicht einmal geschenkt genommen.
39896530.developer_response:
Ich bedauere, Sie haben Probleme.

1) Die Amateur Liga ist ein verlängertes Tutorial. Fußballer gibt es Amateure, also sind die Matches nicht taktisch. Wenn deine Fußballer jedoch Fähigkeiten erlernen, wenn du in den Ligen höher gehst, wirst du sehen, dass es viele taktische Tiefen gibt. Sie müssen geschickt Fähigkeiten, Klassen und Positionierung nutzen, um die Gegner zu gewinnen.

2) Ich möchte dir mit dem Spiel helfen. Bitte senden Sie mir die Berichtsdatei nach dem nächsten Absturz:
- finden Sie unser Support-Dienstprogramm STEAM FOLDER\steamapps\common\Football Tactics\config.exe
- Drücken Sie Fehlersuche
- Klicken Sie auf Bericht erstellen
- Schick es mir auf kos @ creoteam. com
- Beschreibe bitte, wenn das Spiel abstürzt

39825387.review:
Данное изделие врет нам прямо с обложки. Футбол... тактика...
Ха! Как бы не так! Спортивные состязания здесь обходятся без звезд мирового футбола, зато в командах широко представлены дауны всех мастей. Эти пронумерованные буратины могут делать одновременно не более трех действий на всю команду!..

Прокачать разрекламированные разработчиком "скиллы" быстро не получится. Реиграбельность тупо заменили задрачиванием опыта. Это что, ММОРПГ с бронелифчиками?? Какого черта тупо терпеть боль пару сезонов из-за топорного подхода разработчиков к балансу?

И, поверьте, я немало "тактиксов" повидал в своей жизни - здесь же, мы имеем сову, наполовину натянутую на глобус! Луноликий Captain Tsubasa даже в своей 8-битной инкарнации заткнет за пояс это исчадие тупиковой ветви игропрома.

Не покупать этот казуальный полуфабрикат ни в коем случае. По крайней мере, пока не завезут баланс вместо тупого наколачивания опыта.
39825387.developer_response:
Вы правы, что в Любительской лиге тактики фактически нет. На то они и любители. В Третьей лиге, когда футболисты обучаются владеть базовыми навыками, уже появляется возможность противостоять чуть более сильным клубам, чем ваш, с помощью тактики. Однако для этого нужно хорошо понимать, как работают навыки и как использовать особенности каждого класса, как их комбинировать между собой. 

И хоть наша игра в первую очередь о развитии клуба через тактические матчи, вы можете начать игру сразу в Премьер лиге с полностью прокачанной командой. Для этого:
1) Начните новую кампанию
2) Выберите вкладку Специльных настроек
3) Включите опцию "Начало в высших лигах"
Первые команды в списке будут одними из самых сильных в лиге. Выбирайте любой клуб и проводите тактические матчи. 

Но здесь очень важно понимать тактические возможности игры. Расстановка каждого футболиста на поле, позиционирование и комбинирование классов, умение выполнять прострелы с фланга и защищаться от них, владение навыками играют громадную роль.

Если что-то непонятно, нажмите знак вопроса в верхнем правом углу. Там вы найдете информацию о каждом навыке, действии, классе, тактических особенностях.

Надеюсь, когда вы разберетесь с тактическими элементами игры, вы поменяете свое мнение.

39720309.review:
steam第二个入的游戏，从此走上了买买买的无尽之路。从cm03-04就喜欢上足球经理的铁杆游戏迷，但对于这款游戏还是推荐打折入吧。
前期比较难，尤其是尽量不要没实力前升级到高一级的联赛。后面球员的价格越来越贵，对手实力却越来越强。尽量升级青训和球探。后面买来球员后表现好的球员根本续约不起，所以看来只能从青训方面和自己买些便宜的球员培养然后赚钱这方面入手了，我想这游戏也是比较简单版的fm游戏把。后续内容稍微不够丰富，所以如果你像我一样都是足球经理的铁杆粉丝，还是推荐打折的时候入是性价比最高了。
PS： 比赛选择的时候尽量别用模拟模式去玩，就是直接看最后比赛结果，这样子会很容易失去自己排兵布阵的乐趣。
PS2: 感觉守门员位置很重要。
PS3: 希望开发者能开发出更多的游戏内容吧。
